name: Amanda Saenz
text: This is the slowest bank I have ever been too.  My employer banks here and we have to make commercial deposits.  We stopped going to this location and went to the other lakeshore branch due to sometimes being there 45 minutes getting the deposits done.  Unfortunately for some insane reason Regions closed the other Lakeshore branch and we are back to having to go to this one now.  Today we go to make 7 deposits we get up to the tube and are told to drive to lane that is closed and wait while they do the deposits.  Keep in mind you still can’t go into the building so drive thru is our only option to taking care of our business.  While waiting for the deposits to get done 7 cars went thru and got taken care of.  Then they tell me over the speaker to get back into an open lane and wait behind the 3 cars to receive my receipts and money bag.  I couldn’t get from the lane I was parked in that they told me to go to because that one is broke.  I made them bring it to me out front because I was waiting in the line.  I have contacted my corporate office and we are in the process of changing banks now because this is not how you treat customers.  I shouldn’t of been made to go through hoops to give you our businesses money!

Be sure to include your Google username, and refrain from sharing account or loan numbers. Thank you for your time. -Casey, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: Jerry Jones
text: The ATM has “not accepted depoaits” or not been able to give money after hours for the last 3 weeks. I drive past three Banks to get here. What do you have to do to get the ATM to work?? If you don’t want my money or won’t give me access after hours I’ll take my business elsewhere. Fix the ATM!!

resp.text: Thanks for bringing this to our attention, Jerry. I apologize for the inconvenience this has caused you. I will forward your feedback about the ATM and the customer service at this branch to appropriate team. To get started, please send me an email at HLSocial@wellsfargo.com and mention your review and Google username (no account numbers). I look forward to addressing your concerns. -AJ, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: Rolan Nicolaus
text: Poor customer service. They advertise that they offer business accounts. I went in twice to open a business account with my business license. They don't even know what is required to open an account. They RUDELY took my info and said they would call me but never did. I went to another bank and opened one on the spot.

name: AGeekNamedRoss
text:
I received a cold-call advertising credit card services from this branch.  I told the salesperson that I would immediately call them back to verify that they were who they claimed to be.

It took over 15 minutes to get through.  This tells me that they prefer to cold-call advertise over serving existing customers.  Not a good sign.

I don't do business with businesses who use telemarketing.

name: mary jackson
text: A couple of months ago, I received a check. Because of the type of account I have, I could not deposit check in my account. The banker at the window told me to write it out to my husband on the check. When we did this, the next day, his account was frozen, and all money was lost. Al of our money was LOST. THEY CONSIDERED IT FRAUD.  We were devastated. Nothing was done

name: Gary Grimes
text: No problems always friendly helpful service

resp.text: We appreciate your feedback, Gary. Thanks for choosing Wells Fargo. -Nick, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: DAVID BURKHALTER
text: After banking with this bank over decades of name changes I politely asked to use the restroom.They said they could not let me use the bathroom it was not for public use. Like the motto says real service.

name: Meloni Hinson
text: I went to close both of my accounts on 7/21 because of ridiculous fees, the latest being a fee for NOT using my account enough. So you get fees for using it TOO much and not ENOUGH apparently. I supposedly closed both accounts, had to go back and withdraw a penny after withdrawing all funds for "interest" and then got paperwork from an account manager saying my accounts were closed. Then one month later I get another email saying that my account is $12 in the negative AGAIN for not using the account enough. Apparently the account manager wanted to try to squeeze out another fee without me realizing it! Do NOT go to Wells Fargo to open an account. As we've seen from the multiple news stories, Wells Fargo likes to rip off their customers with their shady business practices. America's First Credit Union is right down the road, go there instead!

So I pumped products came back inside and she said here swipe were CC Go. So I did, of course it denied. I ask her are you sure that's com data?? Well I always have to give trk# DL# to authorize. It denied. I ask her is there someone here familiar with com data??? She backs up, sorta touses my card on the register, sir you gonna have to pay cash. $412.00. clearly she has no idea how the process works. So I ask again and noticed the really nice young man knew what to do so he ask her to switch and she backs off what he's being rude, started raising her voice no no he's not gonna treat me like no Dumb Ass. I awta call police. Really!!! So he ask her to chill, and go in the office and calm down. And handles my transaction swiftly and apologize for her actions. Then she started again using GD, MFn .... unbelievable. This is why I'll never stop, deliver, or anything for the rest of my natural life in Birmingham again.  Ever.

text: Public Laundry is hit or miss but you will be satisfied with the amount of effort that goes into keeping the machines working and clean. I guess you can always expect things to be better but as far as hunting for a good laundry mat you could start here.

name: Cam Holmes
text: Maybe a bit pricey to some, but others see it as the cost of security, product reliability, and most importantly; efficiency. The equipment all looks brand new; partly because the staff is on their toes maintaining it and because it probably is. There's ample security cameras to monitor everything from at least 16 different angles. The digital monitor that lets you know what's being used and what's available using a color system is a nice touch. Plenty of cable viewing monitors as well. The fact that everything has a debit card option makes it redundant to be pressed to acquire change anymore. But the change machine is there just in case.

name: LiLnUgGeT666
text:
I will never visit this location again. The employee that was working tonight/morning was one of the most rude people I've ever encountered. I greeted him with "Good morning, how are you sir?". He responded with only a cold stair as if I wasn't allowed or supposed to be there.

I had an arm full of stuff to purchase and he wasn't at a register when I approached so I unknowingly sat the items at the wrong one. When he eventually sauntered over instead of helping me move the items to the correct one, he just pointed and approached it and staired at me while I moved everything. I didn't mind having to move my stuff but, in my eyes, proper customer service would dictate the employee assist in moving everything because I had no idea I was at the incorrect register when I sat the things down. He also was not wearing a mask, even though there is a sign on the doors saying "masks required inside this facility".

Anyway, maybe I'm just being petty, but it just irked me the wrong way, him with his superior attitude and all. In the grand scheme of things im sure my contributions won't be missed, but treating people in the manner he did me will eventually lead to more people never returning. Management of this facility should probably look for some workers with at least a small amount of pride in their job. I get its only a fuel station attendant job but all jobs, especially ones dealing with the public, should show a little pride in their work and make the customer feel welcome.

name: Melvin Ervin
text: I will agree with the previous customer. This has the most unprofessional and people with poor customer service skills. I visited the establishment this morning on 2/15 to purchase some honey biscuits from the Krispy Krunch. I was engaging in a conversation with an male associate in that department discussing the weather as well as poor customer service I obtained a few days ago in that establishment.  Out of know where, a small petite female yelled from the register saying be quiete! She kept yelling at me in front of customers. I preceded  to the register to pay for my items while the person kept yelling at me.. I told the cashier let me pay for my items because I have to go to work. She grabbed  my items and threw them in the trash and said this is her store. If this person was a manager it explains why the store have poor reviews and act unprofessional. Several  customers left in shock during this person unprofessional act. If I can give this store a zero I would!! If you're looking for a place with great customer service skills this not your place. Don't waste your time..

name: tlane256
text: I filled up yesterday instead of using a Shell gas station like i usually do because of the gas price. My gas total was $26.01. The transaction posted to my account. However, there is another $75.00 pending on my account and th money is unavailable. If i had known thats what circle k does i would have never went there. I travel all through the week and i have never had this happen to me at a gas station, so i called the store last night and the guy said it will be off this morning, so that was a lie and is an inconvenience. Would not recommend this store to no one who wants to fill their car up and keep it moving.

name: Joe Margocs
text: Will be closing account and moving it to another brand. Went to bank to draw out money to make a road trip. The atm didn’t work, I proceeded to go to drive thru, when a banker looked at me and another vehicle pulling up and quickly dropped cones to block us out and said we closed 30 seconds ago! No respect for the very people in their community who provide them with a job by trusting them to hold our money. To act as a communist company by dictating when we can get money by the second. Where is compassion, doing the right thing, helping your community gone? I’m a disabled combat veteran, what if I said , it’s 4 o’clock we stop fighting for your freedom till 9am go defend yourself till then! That’s exactly what she said to customers! That incident made me have to beg for a room in this town for a night till they opened the next day! I slept in my car because of her, I hope she slept well and had a nice meal!!!

text: Worst Navy Federal location period. Zero sense of urgency, lazy and slow. Plan 2 hours of your day if you need to speak to a customer service representative and definitely don't go near lunch time or you will be waiting for hours.

name: Shahari Pierce
text: The services provided are wonderful. The employees are professional, friendly and very helpful to your needs. The major issue I have with this particular branch, is the parking and drive through area.The layout is not large enough or constructed in a way that makes sense. It's extremely inconvenient to park/and or get into line to do drive through services. The wait time is usually around 20-30 mins. If you are parked in the back, it takes sometimes 6 minutes to get out, and there's little driving space to do so. If they address these particular issues, they will have a much higher rating.

text: Firstly I love navy federal there is no better bank ! But I seriously need you all to consider building another location in Montgomery on a bigger lot. I have been trying to come here since last 4 days each time being the same outcome. Currently waiting I know I’ll be late to work , but for this 2021 honeys I need you all to consider a second location . At least set up safe ATM locations around town that are navy federal .

name: Dave Gorman
text: NFCU overall is a great place to bank and has the best rates on loans. This branch though is an absolute disaster. The parking lot is a trap due to the configuration of the drive through lanes so it takes forever to get in or out. Drive through service is very slow.

text: Love Navy Fed and have a had great experience. We’re visiting from out of town and stopped to deposit at this location — they don’t use deposit slips in the drive-thru.... but they will send out a piece of paper for you. Odd and annoying, but still received wonderful and friendly service.

name: Peyton Prausa
text:
I was having a very, very bad day. I'm traveling, and I lost my debit card so I had to drive an hour to get to the nearest branch & use literally the only cash I had (3 whole dollars) just to get enough gas to make it to the bank. When I got there I realized I left my military ID an hour away where I'm staying. I had no gas, no money, and no ID so I was understandably very stressed when they told me I needed my ID to get a replacement.
The manager of the bank made an exception though, and was the kindest lady I have ever met in my entire life. She very quickly helped me out and I now have a new card. The service is incredible and I'm very thankful.

To top it off you get a certain amount of cashier checks free which is wonderful because some other local banks charge a fee that I would find to be unnecessary if I am a member. NFCU is extremely reliable and I will continue to bank with them.

Unless she was stone cold deaf and blind, there’s no way she didn’t hear me or see me standing at the door. She kept her head down doing something the entire time I was standing there and wouldn’t look up or acknowledge me (or unlock the door). I left at 6:08 and she was still busying herself and wouldn’t look up! I drove to this Buddy’s, which was also supposed to be open. There were garbage cans in front of both of their doors and no one inside. Very poor business practices. I won’t be going back to either of these locations.

text: Regions is the worst bank I have ever usesd. Transfer money from s Regions account on  9th but it doesn't get to other Regions account until the 13th.

text: This BP station is closed. It’s currently being remodeled and will reopen as a Chevron station.

name: Jamie Terry
text: Everyone is nice and easy the shelves are well stocked.

name: Donna Boothe
text: Great place to go for gas.

name: Susie Palmar
text:
I am forced to actually give 1 Star.  I didn't want to give even that.   I have chosen 2 different options on the phone, trying to get SOMEONE to answer my call.  I have been on the phone...  on HOLD....  for 20 minutes listening to thier commercials and apologizing for the delayed hold time.  But, they ask me to please remain on the phone for the next available Associate.
This is so disrespectful.  And don't tell me it's because of Covid-19.
Crazy, Im still on HOLD, while typing in this review.  It just told me that, "Your call is important to us and to please stay on the line".     REALLY??

resp.text:
Susie,
Sounds like we didn’t provide you with the same member service that many have come to know us for. We are sincerely sorry. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional member service. Please email Listeners@AlabamaCU.com when you have a free moment and provide your contact information so we can work to rectify the situation.
Thank you, Alabama Credit Union

name: Elaine Mathis
text:
Have always  had great customer service inside the bank prior to the Covid-19 virus.
I must say this bank has excellant adaptable employees. Excellant customer service continues at the drive-thru..  Ms. Hall the BM
and  tellers always available and efficient.

resp.text:
Elaine,
We’re thrilled you enjoyed the drive-thru experience during the COVID-19 outbreak. We like making our members happy at Alabama Credit Union! Thanks for leaving the positive review, we hope to see you again soon.
Regards,
Alabama Credit Union

name: Andrew black
text: I've been banking here for years and only had any trouble a time or two but nothing major. Easy to get a saving and checking account with no fees.

resp.text:
Andrew,
We’re thrilled you enjoyed your membership for many years.  We like making our members happy at Alabama Credit Union! Thanks for leaving the positive review, we hope to see you again soon.
Thanks, Alabama Credit Union

name: Kathryn Bigham
text: I wish that I could like this location because it is extremely convenient to my house. However, every time that I go through the drive thru the girl in the window never says a word to me. As a matter of fact, 5 minutes ago I sat in the outer lane for 15 minutes and she spoke and took care of 3 different people in the inner lane and never spoke a word to me. I'm furious.

name: Christopher Smith
text: People are very rude here and they close at 5 not 6

name: Bryan McElroy
text: Great service for all of your banking needs

name: Terrance Andrews
text: All the folks at this branch are awesome at what they do!!

name: Teresa Kenney
text: Always fast with exceptional staff!

name: albert mccracken
text: It's  a nice store, clean with knowledgable employees with a hardee's attached to the building.

resp.text: Hi there, thank you for your feedback and for choosing our store!

name: Aprille Smalley
text: Great selection of stock

name: Chad Chadwick
text: Owner & staff are super friendly!  Support your local small business owners and keep your money in the community.  They value their customers and will make sure you leave happy and satisfied with your experience.  Trust me, if you try it, you will go back!

name: Scotty Davis
text: Great

name: Jasonlee Gross Thornhill
text: This is the friendliest place to get a lone we have been going throu this cash express for 2 yrs now

name: Nikki McDowell
text: Very friendly staff!

name: David Edwards
text: If you do any mobile banking, go elsewhere. They continually "update" their system which then blocks your access to the app. The only way to regain access is to go through customer service. The number listed on their app and website can't be reached, so you have to Google your local location which then goes to the customer service department. Stay on hold there for 10 minutes, a recording tells you your call is important and your estimated wait time is 8 minutes 59 seconds. Ten minutes later, the same message about your call being important comes on, but now your wait time is 8 minutes 55 seconds. Seriously, go to Alabama Credit Union. At least their stuff works and they know how to answer a phone.

resp.text: Hi David, Centennial Bank strives to provide excellent service to our customers. We have received your complaint and acknowledge your frustration with the updates to Mobile Banking. We want to assure you that we will take the opportunity to address your concerns within the Bank. We offer our sincere apology. We know you have choices and appreciate you choosing Centennial Bank. Feel free to contact us with any further concerns at https://www.my100bank.com/#get-in-touch.

name: Joni Baechdr
text: Always great customer service. Please send me your number to check my balance information.

name: Sidney Lynne
text: I use more than one branch but am often in Foley and bank here. I really like the staff, especially Paige. Everyone is eager to help and takes time to address any questions.

name: Prachi Patel
text: Absolutely love the staff, great people!

name: Sandy Broadbent
text: Always friendly service.

name: austin reynolds
text: Easily the most unhappy place in headland. My experience with the cashiers was unpleasant and awkward feeling to say the least.

name: Sonya Scholl

text: top notch as far as banks go alway good people

Typical atm at has station
Simple user interface

name: Shelton Wheeler
text: Awful Awful service this place has the worst service. Trying to get diesel and they don't even know how to run the equipment. As I'm posting this I have been here an hour and still not payed for yet. I will never come back to any kangaroo. There training of there staff is totally unacceptable.

name: Holly “Mrs. Willhite” Barker
text: Very sweet elder man that works the register. He was very interested in asking how my day was and if I found everything I needed for my trip that day. He was a super nice cashier☺☺

name: amanda nieft
text: Gas & cigarettes are about average in pricing but enjoy stopping here because of Grace, one of the attendants; she has a cheerful & upbeat personality. She always aims to go above and beyond in satisfying each customer's needs and is always personable in the way of making you feel welcomed.

name: Clark Chiles
text: Store is dirty and surrounded by men looking for day labour.   The attendants are friendly & helpful.

name: D Corbin
text: It's a BP gas station, sometimes better price, than Sam's. Sometimes.

name: daniel self
text: The best gas prices in Bham

name: Jessica Miller
text: Went and bought a gallon of milk, that I didn't get a receipt for. Brought it home and it was spoiled. Had no choice but to pour it out. Really upset I wasted my money.

name: Chad Kelley
text: This store's service and gas has always been subpar at best but lately (past month) has gone from mediocre to trash

Pros: Gas
Cons: hard to get in and out

name: Gleason Simpson
text: Theee is a reason these people only have a 2.7 rating. This is the absolute worst bank I have ever dealt with! Me and my client tried for over 6 hours to wire $2500 for one REGIONS account to another REGIONS account and still can’t get it done. They want to hold $1000 of it for three days and we ended up ha I got to expedite the rest through a bill pay check just to have access to OUR money! Not regions money to hold and draw interest for three days when it is needed by the people it belongs to!   And the old woman there is as rude as they come! I understand it’s not the employees fault regions is the way they are and the rest of the employees are as nice as could be. The old woman needs to retire!

resp.text: We're sorry for any frustration you have had. Our team has made sure to document these concerns and forward them to the correct team. If you would like to share any additional information, please email us at askRegions@regions.com. -Ana

name: Wanda Belvin
text:
My daughter made an appt for 2:15pm on 03/17/21. She arrived at the scheduled time. She knocked and knocked and no one ever came to the door to let her in. She observed people inside but the tellers ignored her. She calls the bank phone number and no one answers. So she had to leave.
She needed to make a withdrawal larger than the ATM allows.
How is she to manage her account and make withdrawals when the bank refuses to follow their own “rules” of making an appointment?
Absolutely ridiculous...and by the way, other banks in town have their drive thrus open but not this one

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your daughters experience. Our team has made sure to file these details and send them up to the correct team to review. If you would like to add any information, please feel free to send us an email to askRegions@regions.com. -Ana

name: Rebecca Roberts
text: Worst bank I have ever encountered. Think twice before banking with Regions

name: Gene Peppers
text: This is the Worst Bank I have ever dealt with! I don't know why you respond to these reviews for them to contact you, knowing that you will do nothing, as usual

name: Andrew Frungillo
text: ATM never works there

resp.text: We apologize for the inconvenience, Andrew. Please send us an email to askRegions@regions.com detailing the issues you've been having with the ATM. We'll pass this to our ATM team for further review. -Tyler

name: Vickie Thompson
text: This is one of the friendliest banks in town has a nice kind common atmosphere. The people that work here are very nice. This is a nice place to bank for all your banking needs checking or savings. The ladies that work and the department to get your loans or very nice to work with and they help as much as possible for you to get a loan. They also will help you manage your account if something gets out of whack. You get a discounted safe deposit box by having a checking account there have a great savings. I personally bank here and would not trade it for another bank I've had many loans. Very easy to work with on any occasion to fit your every need when it comes to banking.

name: Alisha Pickett
text: I didn't even want to give them one star, but that was the only was I could write the review. Regions is stealing money from my husband's account, please no one open a account here! They are also doing the same thing to my neighbors. When we confront them about that act like we're the stupid ones and we have proof! So please do not open at regions.

name: Amanda Langley
text: The staff is always wonderful here. I absolutely love this bank.

name: Joanna
text: This small town backward bank staff listens to gossip from a soirée that has been in my personal life for fifteen years and treats me like his word is the gospel. If he was unhappy to the extent of being financially abused , why does he continue to keep me on his accounts? They are too envolved with our personal affairs to treat me descent. I am a client as much as he is, they should have the fortitude to understand business is business and tell him the same. Instead they will not say one word to me when I drive thru or at the counter. I feel like I am wearing the scarlet letter.

name: Rob Parker (Big Body)
text: I think they are great

name: Loren Bodine
text: Sucks!!! So far not having a good experience with the regions bank in Guntersville

name: Easy G
text: Horrible customer service

name: Carrie Jones
text: Love my local branch. Always friendly. Always helpful. Thank you!

resp.text:
Carrie, thank you for your review! We appreciate the 5-star rating!
Thanks,
Redstone

name: Sheri Chumley
text: I use Redstone Federal Credit Unoin and this is the closest one I have found to Boaz. We definitely need a location closer to Boaz.

resp.text:
Hi, Sheri. Thank you for your rating! We're happy to hear that your experience with us has been good.
Thanks,
Redstone

name: Angel Hall
text: Me, my husband and daughter love this branch. The tellers are great at their job and they truly care about you. Every time my husband goes in and they’ve not seen me in a while they ask about me and my health. They have got to know me and are aware of my health problems and they always accommodate me in anyway they can. We have been with them for several years, and they have had the same tellers the entire time which is always a plus.

name: James Ray Furr
text: Guntersville Redstone employees have been the best. They have never hesitated to find time for me. Even when I just have a ton of questions...

name: Roger Williams
text: I recently opened an account here and got an auto loan. Working with Tiffany to begin the process and then coming back to finalize it with Donna has been one of the best loan applying experiences that I have ever had. Everyone has their bad days, but so far at Redstone FCU, everyone has been so nice.

name: Vickie Thompson
text: Convenient location this is a quick location for fast service in and out. Customer service is very kind and courteous. I do recommend this area for your convenience and banking needs.

name: William Irby
text: Great friendly service

name: C Cofield
text: It's a bank. Very nice people inside.

name: Harold S
text: Great friendly hometown bank

name: Elizabeth Eppler
text: Good service, great credit union, good benefits.

name: Joey Davis
text: The tellers can be a little more less rude and im not even a member.

name: Daniel Mccormack
text: Super nice understanding and supportive staff. Will take extra time to help with any questions or anything else you need.

resp.text: Hi Daniel. Thank you for the rating and review! We appreciate having you as a customer.

name: Jourdan Lowery
text: Great bank just stopped here to cash a check but very friendly employees and clean real good bank to do business with

resp.text: Thank you for the review, Jordan. We appreciate having you as a customer!

name: Nikki Dole
text: Very nice ladies, clean restrooms and the food was amazing.  Definitely added this truck stop to our route.

name: Jason Shoumaker
text: I stopped to get a great breakfast for me and my brother as we run teams, 1 of only 2 truck stops that had become a must to stop when traveling on I-22 but after this am it will become a place that we will not stop at for anything there's only 2 toilets in men's restroom one was occupied and the other was absolutely disgusting, it had feces all over toilet seat, told cashier about it and asked to use a shower for restroom and was told nope thats what the restrooms are for.

name: Sergio Leyva
text: Big parking lot. Friendly staff. Truck diesel. Not much food but huddle house next door

name: Robert Martin
text: The people are friendly, the food from the cafe inside was delicious, only down fall is the mens room, it was nasty, only 1 stall was working and a line of people waiting to use it.

name: Tony
text: Great place for finding parking. Huge lot with a small paved section with the rest being gravel. Virtually no holes in the gravel which was great. Inside was alright and the bathrooms could use some attention.

name: MusicMovesMe78
text:
4/21/21 - still set this lovely place on my route for this good home cooking. Tonight for dinner: fried fish fillets, turnip greens, mashed potatoes, regular cornbread, and a piece of birthday sprinkle vanilla cake with lemon frosting for dessert. Finish it off with a cup of sweet tea. ❤ (Obviously I like their fried fish fillets.)

Also, they have since remodeled the restrooms and have added showers for $10.00 each. Dont listen to the folks who are fussin' in the comment section here. Come on in and try out Cafe 30, great truck parking (if you get in at a decent time) and friendly folks inside. 👍🏻👍🏻

2019:  Who needs Huddle House next door when you have a diner like this in the truck stop? Super good food and friendly customer service. Not hating on Huddle House. They're great, too ... but this? This is that food right here.

name: Linda Danahy
text:
Just your average convenient store.
However, the food in the deli is so delicious.
Freshly made with homemade taste.
Worth the stop.
Big rig truck parking.
Saving this place on my GPS.

name: Phillip Vineyard
text: Really good food. They serve breakfast and the pancakes are as big as a to go box hot and delicious. The lady that was working the morning of 4-8-2020 was really nice (and pretty) worth stopping for, big parking lot the back is a little rough bc its gravel front lot is paved. ENJOY !!!!!

name: shelby phillips
text: Country fried steak was delicious... Cashier was super friendly... Don't let the outside appearance fool you... It's worth the stop!

name: arc gaming
text: Women’s bathroom had several holes in the wall and a large hole in the ceiling. Felt kinda creepy, but we had been on the toad awhile, so whatever. My husband paid for our gas but then My daughter wanted a snack...A pack of gum and a bag cheese it’s. Was around $3. Lady at the register told me that they don’t allow purchases under $5 on a card...only cash. So I told her to keep it. Cashier even made the comment that they get a lot of angry customers because of it. I can see why. Went across the street to the Shell station. Much cleaner, the same items were about a dollar cheeped and they didn’t mind to do business transactions under $5 dollars. Wish we had given them out gas business too. Will remember that next time.

name: Jourdan Lowery
text: Looks better cashier are friendlier since the new management took over last week great food at the cafe 30 the manager already got new locks on the stall doors and they sell phone cards again they even have a small dog park now where travelers can walk their dogs

name: Truckin Games
text: Review just for the parking. Usually can find spots most of the time.

name: Truth and Justice
text: Great home cooked food for a great price! Meat and two sides with a drink and bread of your choice only $8! Nice little place to sit down and eat with a tv! Tons of parking in the gravel lot out back! Good experience here every time!

name: Max Cady
text: My wife and I usually stop in this place once or twice a year when driving from Memphis to Atlanta, religiously we purchase a new US road atlas map in this store. We noticed they stopped carrying road maps and atlases, plus they got rid of all sorts of stuff. So we drove down to Loves truck stop and got a new atlas map there. We will now go to Loves from now on. It’s around exit 50

name: Loren Collins
text: Clutch place to park . Lots of truck parking. Huge lot. Nice food. Was low on hours needed a place to stop. Good phone signal 👍

name: Cynthia Keene
text: Cafe 30 in the Chevron station has the best homemade food. The roast beef w/potatoes & carrots, purple hull beans, cabbage and cornbread was very tasty.

name: Joseph Bennett
text: Get a filling meal for under 10 dollars. Plenty of paved and unpaved big rig parking. Sassy workers that make you smile and a place to sit, that isn't that truck. Overall a decent experience. They do have a huddle House next door, if you are to uppity to eat good southern cooking.

name: Tammy Harbin
text: Awesome homemade hamburgers , employees are nice good parking and fuel prices are great bathrooms need a little over haul but great place

name: Norbert D Dounseroux
text: I chose to stop here seeing I hadn't been here in a couple years. I have no problem supporting the little stops and was surprised to see they finally saved enough money to asphalt some of the truck parking. I guess the stripes will come way later. My offense was the men's room, smells, no locks on the stalls, and trash on the floor. You have a long way to go!

name: Karl Wolf
text:
Nice place for a driver to stop and get a bite to eat. Food is reasonable and served with a smile.
Plenty of truck parking as long as you park properly.
Not sure about all the bad reviews regarding the restrooms, its not a 5 star hotel and was adequate for my needs.
Will stop here again.

name: BOGUS Blank
text: Women behind counter said nothing at all.when I go to a normal place of business I am usually greeted with hello may I help you.not here made me feel like I did something wrong or maybe my long hair out of place for the southern folks.when I did get my food of which I ordered to go I had to ask for a bag.oh bathroom stalls are falling apart and no paper towels in bathroom how is a trucker going to wash their face and dry it?oh I know stick your head in the blow dryer! Other than all that it's a place to park and go to the restroom as long as you don't expect any privacy when you sit on the toilet.

name: Ana Shomaker
text:
This place was disgusting, the guy who runs it is trash too. I told him the restrooms were beyond filthy and he told me that it was only him there and that he has 1 person come clean it at night, I told him they could do a better job because it doesn’t look like anything has been wiped down swept or mopped or weeks.
It’s prolly got parasites all over the place.

It’s even more disappointing that when I told the man he didn’t even apologize he just argued with me about it.
Also across the board the gas has been anywhere from 2.30 to 2.50 and his gas was way over priced at 2.75.
Pretty sure he was selling cigarettes to underage kids as well.

name: GaryMac
text: Great food at great prices. Them girls in there can cook. A lot of truck parking. And if you don't like home cooking there is a Huddle House next door. I stop here all the time. Good place.

name: Sean Kerno
text: Bathrooms are fairly rundown. There's no way to make sure your stall cannot be opened once inside. They do have any snacks or drinks you could want. But if looking for a restroom, I'd keep driving.

name: J Dial
text: Really good stop! Home style cooking 🍳😍. It's clean and the people are friendly. Good location for a nap or simple pit stop. Always a stopping spot on the roadtrip

name: Brian Chapman
text:
Not a thing wrong with this stop.  It was Memorial day weekend so they weren't cooking.  LARGE amount of parking.  The pot holes weren't so bad. The men's room was clean while I was there.  No smell either.
I didn't use the stalls so don't know if if they locked or not.

If people are so fearful of the restrooms I don't know why they don't go next door to the Huddle House.

name: Pamela Cloud
text: Good food nice portions nice staff breakfast lunch dinner cakes are moist

name: Noble Eagle
text: Awesome food. More than you can handle. If you go away hungry,  it's your fault.

name: Theresa Lowery
text: Great place good food clean restroom  friendly staff really loved the chevron even the parking lot was  clean

name: Tiffany Caballero
text: This place is clean, it has a good selection and the employees are so friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend it.

name: Ray
text: Incredible home cooked breakfast. And the best french toasts in the country.

name: Steve Whisenant
text: Nice stop. Good food.

name: John Kranz
text: The food is really good, the people are friendly, plenty of parking, however the men's room was delapated and they have no milk, but a lot of beer

name: Bobby Kiselak
text: Plenty of parking for big vehicles, especially 18 wheelers. There's a small kitchen here with some booths. The restrooms need updating/more cleaning, but overall it serves it's purpose as a wanna be truck stop.

name: Andrea Scott
text: If I could give 0 stars I would. I am a woman truck driver and this bathroom was absolutely unacceptable, I've been through my fair share of truck stop bathrooms and this was by far the worst! One toilet seat wasn't even on the toilet and the other toilet was stuffed with toilet paper to the point where I was scared to flush it to try to use the bathroom. I don't understand how so many women work here and that bathroom is not decent, you have to use that bathroom all day! Living in a truck these bathrooms are my only options and I've never been so pissed, sad sad excuse for a truck stop! If you have a wife or you are a woman truck driver do yourself a favor and pass this exit, for your own health. I'm very upset about having to stop here for the night.

name: christopher falkenberry
text: Food is great!!!!!!! People are nice no showers but lots of parking. 150+ parking spaces for semi.

name: Mark Summers
text: Excellent burger. Nice folks.

name: Nathan Shelton
text: Sorry excuse for a truck stop only thing good about it is they have some parking

name: David Moreno
text: The food is good the the people are really nice to you the only bad thing is that they don't have any showers plenty of parking

name: Bob Kernahan
text: Great place plenty of truck parking great people and good food

name: Douglas Carmen
text: Lots of truck parking. Good food. Friendly people.

name: Geoffrey Stephens
text: Easy on /off huge parking area, good food.

name: ANN WISE
text: Huddle house next door.

name: Mj
text: Good food here

name: HARRY LEE WILSON
text: The atmosphere and food is excellent.

name: Hershel Thompson
text: Your average truck stop, nothing grand about it. Large amount of truck parking.

name: Pete Ward
text: Good food,no showers,lots of truck parking

name: Thomas Stetina
text: “Underclothes”???  Stank... enough said.

name: Roy Willingham
text: Gd food lots of parking

name: Melissa Montoya
text: Lots of parking spots

name: Rebecca Richardson
text: Stopped in for a drink and my friend got some snacks. They have a small selection of items to choose from in the store. It had easy access from highway 278.to the station. They did have atomic fireballs at this location.

name: Chad Bartlett
text: They sell deli items gas and ammunition

name: Eddie Snow
text: Convenient. Nice people. But come on. 4 drive through lanes and 1 person working all 4. Just ridiculous on Regions part.

resp.text: We certainly hear your concerns and have made sure to pass them to our Complaints team for further review. If there's any other concerns our team can address with you, please email us at askRegions@regions.com. -Tyler

name: Lindsey Nicole
text:
This bank is completely understaffed. This is twice I have wait 45 minutes for a banking transaction through the drive through... that is insane. I counted 31 cars while I sat and waited. This branch is suffering and so are the staff! I feel for the workers as they are always so friendly and do not deserve to be working understaffed.  Regions, do better and higher more employees!

My husband and I have been banking her for 10 + years and we are changing banks now because of this issue. I can no longer handle the wait time because of the other branch closing in Gardendale.

resp.text: We've made sure to have this matter documented. If we can learn more, please send us an email to askRegions@regions.com with your phone number. -Tyler

name: ildiko kiraly
text: Regions Bank in Gardendale is completely understaffed. The last few times I’ve gone through the drive through, the lines have been 20 cars deep and the walk in is at least 10 deep. They close the other branch, laid off staff but never replaced them at the now overwhelmed branch. The poor tellers are constantly apologizing to customers for the wait time.  Stop cutting costs.

resp.text: We'd like to apologize for your experience. Our team has made sure to document these details. If we can ever assist you, please feel free to send us an email to askRegions@regions.com. -Ana

name: ProYak Fishing
text: This branch serves a huge geographical area and is always lined out into the road. Not uncommon to spend 30 mins in the drive thru. There really needs to be another branch in the area or more staff to accommodate the high customer volume. This has been a problem here for a long time.

resp.text: Hey, there! Our team would like to make sure we have these details fully documented. If we can chat with you, please send us an email with your phone number to askRegions@regions.com. -Ana

name: Brick Mason
text: I contacted them with a Regions credit card issue that I had. Regions posted my payment into the wrong account so I was told by corporate to contact the local branch manager. I talked with an assistant manager and was reassured that he would talk with the manager to get it resolved and they never called back. Regions has no loyalty to their customers.

resp.text: Our apologies for any frustration this may have caused. We definitely hear your concerns and appreciate your feedback. We've made sure to pass it along to the appropriate channels. If you'd like to further discuss, feel free to email us at askRegions@regions.com. -Trish

name: Harleigh Love
text: This branch is really good. I walked in and was immediately greeted. I only had to wait about 5 mins to speak with someone. Everyone was super nice and helped me with everything I came in for and more. I will definitely be going to this branch more.

name: Michael Bell
text:
Gardendale Regions:
Ridiculously long wait times in drive-thru. Have never seen more than 2 tellers working the drive-thru.
Wait times inside also bad - has only been 1 or 2 tellers helping inside when I have been there; there is a greeter, which I don't need - put the greeter behind a teller station to actually help!
And don't tell me you will "pass this along" like you tell others because nothing changes.
Sorry I left BNVA to come to this Regions. Think I will switch to BB&T.

resp.text: We apologize for the inconvenience this has caused for you when visiting this location. We've made sure to have this documented. We appreciate your feedback and if we can help with anything else, please don't hesitate to reach out. -Tyler

name: Summer Glover
text: Don’t bank here unless you enjoy sitting in lines that never move.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear that you experienced an extended wait time at your visit. If our team may ever assist you with anything, please feel free to email us at askRegions@regions.com. -Ana

name: Jeff Neu
text: Slow and very poor service.

resp.text: Our apologies for any frustration and your wait time. We have forwarded your concerns to the appropriate channel. If you'd like to further discuss, be sure to email us at askRegions@regions.com. -Trish

name: Rakesh Patel
text: This branch really need a help.  Need to open up a branch in Morris or Warrior some ware. Need a new manager tooo. I am with regions since 11 years. Never seen like this before. Manager didn’t resolve my problem I had.

name: Chickadee
text: The drive through is ridiculous!! It’s too slow every time I come. Wait time 30 minutes or longer.

name: Paul Hamer
text: Please fix the EXTREMELY SLOW Saturday Drive thru service! Come on. Every weekend it just sucks having to wait forever because of short staffing! Add personnel and solve this issue.

name: Anthony Crowe
text:
I only gave one star because there is nothing lower.
Not sure who the lady was running the drive thru but it was only 9:30 am and apparently she was already in a bad mood. My office manager had asked me to drop off the credit card payments for her since this option is no longer available to do online any longer. I pulled into the drive thru no one in front of me, know one behind and hand her the payments. She quickly snaps at me that there is a 3 transaction maximum in the drive thru. I tell her I didn't know and with attitude she says "It's right there on the sign".  Next she complains because the office had not torn off the check stubs as she puts all but 3 of the payments back in the drawer for me to get. I asked her what she was doing and she said we have a 3 transaction limit. I look in my mirror and still I'm the only person in the drive thru. I told her to just give me those 3 back and I would go to another branch which I did. The Regions in downtown Birmingham on 3rd Ave S knows how to treat customers. I will never go back to the Odum Road location and will be switching all my company visa's to another bank.

name: Phyllis Brewer
text: I opened my account at five star in 2016 after moving back to Eufaula Alabama.  It was recommended to me by a close friend who along with himself his whole family are long time members. From the moment I stepped in the Eufaula Alabama branch the first thing I noticed was the branch was very clean and well organized. The next thing I noticed was that all of the employees were very professional and worked as a team with the common goal service to each and every customer. I even noticed that when there was no one at the drive thru the employees came in the main area to help the other tellers   My wait was less than three minutes before I was ushered into an office where I was thoroughly enjoyed the process and very well educated on all of my options.   Every time since I have opened my account I have never been dissatisfied with my service. I have used the online banking,  drive thru, night deposit, automated system,  phone service to branch to speak with someone, going into branch to dispute resolution and when my account was in negative due to a double charging from another source.  They printed off copies of my account.  They also introduced me to a repayment over draft plan. They also completely refunded over draft fees and double charges with no hassle.  And they also referred me to the dispute resolution office for some things they couldn't do they also referred me to main branch for further assistance.  They have also have informed me of certain privileges that comes with membership. That I would have never been aware of if they hadn't taken the time to show me.

All we hear from the realtor and lawyer is that the Credit Union employees at 5 Star can't perform their jobs.  I am active duty military and have wasted several leave days on rescheduled closings.  Again today the closing has been postponed.  I hope Karma comes knocking on whomevers door and they get it right back 7 fold.

name: Allison Ostrowski
text: I actually rate this branch 0 stars. The worst customer service I have ever received. I've been a loyal banker with Wells Fargo for 3 years and they treated me as if I were insignificant today. I spoke with the manager because of a situation where my fiance went to deposit money in my account (as he has many times before theough the ATM and with a teller) because im at work and he was told he couldn't. The option wasn't there with the ATM either. So I called to inquire on if the policy has changed or of the ATM was no longer offering the option. I was told they have no control over who deposited at the ATM multiple times as if I were an idiot and then told that the policy changed in May (ever think to notify customers when policies change?). I was told he could deposit a check or money order but to deposit cash would be fraudulent. When I pointed out his tone and the fact that he was talking down to me he continued with "so you called over something I have no control over and I told you I have no control over and your upset because I can't control it, is that correct?" That is very riderand condescending. II wil be closing my account and banking else where as soon as possible. No wonder this branch only has 3 stars. He is a poor excuse of a manager and exemplimes customer service at it's absolute worst. He refused to give me his name at the end of the call but thankfully I document everything and when I don't I always do my recon and research. A little trick I have learned working in customer service the past 10 years is record every conversation. Unfortunately I didn't start recording in the very beginning of the conversation when he said his name, as I did not expect the call to take such a turn. So I only have the last half of the call on record. That's ok though, I will still be going through the proper channels to let Wells Fargo know what poor service I received. It is unacceptable and they deserve to know how their employees are treating their customers so that it can probably be addressed and handled.

name: Andrew Lewis
text: May 1st, 2020 I was waiting on my first paycheck to be deposited into my bank account since January. I called  HR at work and everything indicated that it was deposited. I call the bank, at about 1200 hours and I inquired about the deposit. West Alabama Bank said they received it and shall be in account by 1700. I waited till today, May 4th, 2020 and called my bank to let them know I still have not received the money in the bank. I don't know how long it took for them to call my wife back to let her know they straightened out the problem. But as soon as I can, I will be going to a different back. I can't stand to be lied to about my money.

text: Worst app/credit union I have ever dealt with. It's almost impossible to make a payment. The over the phone option forces you to type out your banking information instead of speaking it, so I can't switch apps to get/add the bank. The stupid app is glitchy and doesn't let you add another bank account to pay from. It will let you link them but before it finalized it says "continue" "redirecting" then glitches back to continue on an endless cycle. I had to use my desktop to pay the bill which by the time I figured out how to pay it was late. Payed and done. Never again.

name: Kelly Graham
text: I have yet to receive a clear response via phone or email regarding a refinance application. I spoke to my Mortgage Originator on Wednesday who said her manager would call me to discuss the application. After waiting two days with no response, I called the manager myself. She began reading our appraisal to me over the phone and I commented that she left off the updated information from the appraiser under the URAR; she then said "Oh I must not have the most updated version"...she made multiple excuses of why I haven't heard anything and still gave me no firm answer on my questions regarding my application. I should've known the process was going to be poorly handled when the Mortgage Processor sent me this email earlier on in the process: "Good morning, I am working on getting a payoff with **current lender**, but am having issues getting a hold of someone to help.  Could you try to get this for me?  I will need the payoff date good through 4/30/21, please! Let me know if you have any luck!"

resp.text:

Thanks,
Redstone

text: Leonard Leach provided excellent customer service and attention to detail on helping me secure a loan for my first house. He was really on top of everything and made sure to explain everything to me. I greatly appreciate the staff at Redstone! I am a very happy customer.

They are messing up like crazy,  seem borderline rude and  are going to be surfed after my using them for 20 years.  Sad day but I don't work for them and will not fix their mistakes. text: Redstone is a great normal non-complicated banking experience.  Everything extra is not good.  DO NOT USE as your Mortgage lender.  Terrible experience.  They have no incentive to do awesome on extra services.  Average 9-5 workers that don't really care what your more complicated objectives require.

name: Stephen Wisener
text: Be Careful if you are a member here. Somehow criminals have gained access AND the ability to call you from one of Redstone Federal credit Union legitimate phone numbers.....a actual business number used by Redstone Federal credit Union! They will attempt to call you and tell you that they are with the fraud department and that they want to verify some purchases made from your account because there were some "red flag" transactions. They will then say did you make a 500 dollar purchase at a Target in "so and so" California......you will say NO then that's when they will proceed to get the ACTUAL information they need to get you money! Be safe, Be aware, and Give NO information unless you are "in person" at the actual Bank. Good luck, and God Bless.

name: Dewayne Trotman
text: Very poor professionalism and customer service.

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback. Please call 866-230-9149 and give us a chance to improve on your experience.
Thanks,
Redstone

name: Joseph Harris
text: I'm not sure if the underwriter that just called me is extremely racist or just don't know what's she's doing. I went to the rural king in Chester Pa and saw an equipment that i wanted to purchase for my business. Spoke to a rep there and he told me that I can apply for their business credit card though redstone federal credit union. So i applied on Sunday 05/18/20. On Monday a Melissa Wilson called me back and said the credit card was approved but she need to open a membership for me first to finalize everything. She took my basic information and said I'll received a docu sign by the end of the day. I got an email from Melissa on Tuesday night saying that the underwriter needed 2 year of business tax returns, a utility bill, a mortgage statement and a selfie of myself with me holding my ID. I thought the last request was a little strange but I submitted everything anyway. Got a call from an underwriter on Wednesday and this is where I think she just dont have a clue about what she's doing or is extremely racist. She asked me how far was rural king store was from me? I told her about an hour plus. She then ask why I close two credit cards in 2019. Told her I had two credit cards from the same company so I requested that they combine the credits from both cards on to one and close one, which they did. And that i didn't close the barclay card. I was an authorized user on the barclay card and the primary user close the card that's why why it appear on my credit as close. But I went ahead and open up my personal barclay card in December of 2019. She then ended by saying well I'm not satisfied with the two cards that were closed, and there's a fraud alert on your credit and this seems like fraud. I told her yes I place a fraud alert on my credit so that no one can open up fraudulent account in my name. A fraud alert will tell a company to give me a call and verify its me before opening up a new account. People do that all the time. She said well this seems like fraud. I told her you have my ID, Mortgage statement, utility bill, my social security number, phone number that you're talking to me on matches the phone number with the credit bureau that's on my fraud alert, my 2 years of business tax return with my business name and my home address. I have a 732 fico score and a 80/100 dunn and Bradstreet score. I have all the credentials needed for approval. Credit, income, etc. But all they saw was a driver's license of a beard black guy, that have a fraud alert place on his credit and two close credit cards that one of them he requested to be closed and the other was close by the primary card holder. And the scary part about this entire situation is the young lady that told me all this is an "underwriter". An underwriter who's racist or an underwriter that don't know that it's legal to call the credit bureau and request that they place a fraud alert on your credit and give them a number to place on your credit to have potential creditors call you and verify its you before opening an account. Also an underwriter that don't know that if you become an authorized user on one of your family members card that entire card history gets transferred to your credit history. And if the person closes that card it will also close on you credit profile. So much for " Equal Opportunity Lender".

resp.text: Let me assure you that RFCU has a strict policy of non-discrimination not only in the credit union’s lending practices, but in all aspects of conduct throughout RFCU. When opening accounts and taking applications for credit, RFCU must complete certain due diligence requirements in order to validate the identity of the applicant, as required by federal law. Due diligence is completed for every applicant in order to both comply with federal law and safeguard our members from potential fraud.

name: Blue Fox Garage
text: They lost my car title. They got their money, so now it’s all on me to get the title back that they lost.

resp.text: We haven’t heard from you, but we want to make certain that your concerns are addressed. If we misplace a title, it is our practice to order a replacement. Please contact our Titles Department at (800)234-1234 ext. 6505, and if we misplaced your title, we will be happy to order a replacement. If your title was sent to the address you have on file with us, then you will need to contact your state’s Department of Revenue to order a replacement. Thanks, Redstone.

name: P J
text:
RFCU does not respect member's time.
There are things that you cant do online and they make sure to not hire enough people for chat or phone bank.
Wonder if Joe has to wait?

name: Jason Webster
text: Great bank and great people. I just don't understand why if the bank says that funds are available on a date that it is not available at 12:01am of that date. Why are the clocks at the bank off by 2 to 3 hours in the am.

name: Haley
text: Extremely friendly staff!! They are always such a big help and very quick. I frequent the one on Wynn Drive a lot and it's always a pleasant experience.

name: Clay McCoy
text: This place has horrible service regarding credit cards. I tried to buy something online and got declined by their buggy fraud detection. I called to resolve it and they wasted 30 minutes, asking the same questions over and over and were never able to fix it. They want to send me a new card!? Idiots.

name: Yuli Chang
text: Good bank, tellers, bank services (SD box, notary, etc) and standard banking accounts (checking, savings, business, MM, CDs) top notch.  You can get better loan rates and credit elsewhere, but for local banking they are great.  Some of their branches can be really crowded depending on time of day.

name: Darren Thole
text: I have banked with RFCU for years and have been very happy up until here lately. I noticed check maintenance fees in the amount of $8/month. The fees can be waived with a direct deposit (the only deposit for me to do is my paycheck which would cost me $10/month so that option's out). The other way for the fees to be waived is by using 4 debit card transactions/month (don't want to use a debit card and will not be forced into using one). I talked with a supervisor because I figure they want my business and will provide some other option. No can do. The supervisor told me that all banks now have check maintenance fees. A very cursory exploration of other options reveals that is not true:  some banks waive any fees with a minimum monthly balance (a balance which I can easily do), some have basic checking accounts which have no fees but limited services (RFCU offered me no such option), and some of the checking accounts that have no fees also pay interest which my Redstone checking account did not. Plus, there are many online banks that have no check maintenance fees. You're wrong RFCU:  there are many others doing banking better than you.

name: David House
text: RFCU on Wynn Dr. was so helpful today.  I was in and out with a car loan in about thirty minutes! Highly recommend Jordan Petty, pleasant, efficient, and knowledgeable.

name: Gary “Gary” Choukse
text:
I called here to ask a query because when I went to the bank, they said if I applied online, I need to call online. I called here and the Representative picked up the call, She kept telling me to visit a branch, while I already visited the branch (branch representative told me to call the E team). She was rude and sounded like a robot. I called again to complain about her rude behavior and found out that she doesn't even belong to the department for which my query was. I think you guys are way low than where your customer service skills should be.
Not even, I wasted my time on the call, I also wasted my visit to 3309 S Memorial Pkwy, Huntsville, AL 35801 (Branch) where the representative told me to call the E team, while she should help me with the account.

name: James Edington
text: The guys at the Wynn Dr branch are super competent, friendly, and efficient. RFCU is good enough as it is, but the staff at this branch are what really brings it up to a 10. If you've had a bad experience with the one on Mills Rd, come visit these guys. It's worth the drive.

text: I am Active Duty stationed on Redstone Arsenal.   My wife took my 14 year old daughter to open her own checking account today.  The associate my wife and daughter spoke with was extremely rude.  I won't go into details, but I am very displeased with the service my family received.  I believe we will be patronizing another banking institution.

text:
I have been banking with RFCU for about 20 years. Now I am looking for a new bank. Their service has been atrocious recently. One example - they decided to "upgrade" my daughter's checking account to a new account type, which doesn't include check writing privileges. Ummm, that's why she has a "checking" account. I called to get this fixed, and was told I have to take my time to come into a branch to fill out a form. They didn't need a form to make the change in the first place.
Overall, I would put this rating in terms that my grandma often used. Redstone seems to have gotten too big for their breeches.

text: I've been banking with redstone for over 10 years and they've always been pleasant and helpful. I recommend them to everyone I know.

text: Never ever ever count on these people for debit cards. Truly below par service. It’s iffy whether or not, after a month I’ll have a new debit card...which sucks because I used my debit card to get paid through Uber. DO NOT COUNT ON REDSTONE, they’ll send it to the wrong address.

text: They're friendly, knowledgeable and as quick as they can be. Plus, free coffee if you get there early enough.

text: Not helpful and extremely unorganized. I'm so tired of having dealings with this credit union and employees giving me false information because they do not know the correct answer. I either get false information or told to call back at another date because the only person capable of answering my questions isn't in at this time. A 1% interest rate difference isn't worth this b.s.

name: Lorna Barnett
text:
To the credit union in whole I have mixed feelings. This branch in particular has been nothing but inconvenient and their over-the-phone service is incredibly poor. The only thing worse is the website.

For the last year I have been having to call and ask repeatedly to have them reset my password because the website refuses to recognize when I have  hanged the password. And since you cannot access the app without first correcting the website, its made even more ridiculous.

Direct deposits taking an hour or two to go through is one thing. However during software updates your whole account may be lost to you for 24 hours if not longer.

I've banked other places and redstone gives less hell at a smaller price. But they still irritate me. My advice, don't bank at all, get a prepaid debit card that has the features you need. As soon as redstone opens I plan to close my account and purchase one.

text: This pitiful gas is the absolute worst gas station I have ever had the misfortune of having stopped at. First of all, the cashiers are the most rude cashiers I have ever come across. text:
October 13th,called and spoke with a representative and told them my goal was to open a business account with them so that I can obtain a SECURED business credit card so i could add to my credit mix. The account was opened and the secured business credit card application was submitted.
My application was drug out over a month because of “covid” just to get a denial letter for the secured business credit card(my own money).
Having a quota to meet every month was mentioned while my account was being set up so It seems my time was wasted just to get me to open an account.

I'm very happy I chose to move to them!

text:
Office hours are 9 to 5. I show up at 10 to cash a $90 check. Only the drive up window is operating. After waiting 15 minutes I'm told there is a $10 fee to cash a check written on a Compass account.
Never accept a check written on Compass bank accounts. Sorry customer relationship

name: Bethanie Ricci
text: The ATM ate my debit card on Monday (their ATM has been having issues but I’m sure it will get resolved). However, whenever I went inside the branch to let a teller know what the issue was, Brittany filed a maintenance call to the ATM repairer and proceeded to have a new card expedited to me. I got my card on Wednesday (2-3 days later as Brittany had promised) and whenever I went to activate my card, I saw that another debit card had been requested for me. Upon calling the branch, Brittany picked up and explained how she’d checked on Wednesday morning to see if my new card had been sent. She didn’t see any conformation, so she proceeded to request another card for me. Now I have my primary debit card and a back up on the way. Brittany did a fantastic job and her customer service is excellent. Thank you for making this annoying experience as painless as possible and displaying excellent customer consideration.

name: The Awakening Enthusiast
text:
If you are looking for a good bank this is definitely not the place you want to go. I'm not speaking out of anger I'm speaking from experience I am currently dealing with this bank and they have put me and my family through the biggest hardship do to their lack of caring and lack of communication.

We deposited a check as anyone would do when somebody gives them a check we never had the funds available to us until the check would clear so we never spent any of the funds at all. we sat patiently waiting like normal people would for the check to clear. The check didn't clear which in a normal case it would just tell you that the check did not clear and maybe charge you a fee or something. No no no not here not with BBVA Compass. Nope they take it and put a hold on the check even after it doesn't clear and then take your account in the negative the amount of that check and then refused to take the hold off and let you continue to get fees with bills that are trying to go through even though you have a very positive balance that they are withholding from you.

Right now because of this Bank my car payment is going to be late as well as one of my credit cards I drive for Uber and Lyft all of my money that gets deposited goes into that account which I cannot deposit in turn leaves me with an empty gas tank so I cannot work so there's money I'm losing also. This Bank when we called the gentleman that we spoke with on the phone refused to let us speak to a manager we have the conversation recorded and when we told him that we needed a manager or somebody higher up to try to fix this for us and we were being polite mind you, his exact words were no he won't know he won't as in saying no the manager will not clear it up and then he refused he said that he refused to put us on the phone with somebody higher up.

I'm sorry but in normal cases if you deposit a check into your bank account and it doesn't go through it doesn't take you into the negative the entire check amount especially if you have a positive balance. This just shows BBVA Compass true colors and I will make sure to let anybody know that I come in contact with which is a lot of people because I drive for both Uber and Lyft that BBVA Compass is not for the people they are for themselves!

name: Steve Slone
text:
I have been with BBVA Compass way before they added BBVA, I have stayed with Compass because of the professional service , the friendly smile they greet me with and the attitude they have when I have a question or need help with the things that come up just day to day.
Thank you !!!

text: Very sweet staff. Two ATMs available, however during business hours the drive thru ATM lane is also a window banking lane making it impossible to zip through quickly as other drive up ATMs. After hours it is convenient but not while window is open.

name: Arthur Lamounier Moura
text:
The staff was really helpful and attentive, and tried to solve my situation and provide me the information I needed. However, if you're an international student, they do not allow you to open the simplest account without having a Social Security Number with you. This is very odd, considering that all the other banks in town accept the regular immigrant documents, such as visa, I-20, passport, etc. Also, Auburn University is an institution that receives lots of International students for all over the world every semester and this Credit union did not think of a good solution for this type of customer...

Since I had to open an account in one way or another, I had to choose another bank, in my case Chase Bank... So be aware of that if you're an international student!

resp.text:
Mr. Moura,

AU Credit Union accepts one or more of the following documents for a non-U.S. person:
- Taxpayer Identification Number
- Passport Number and Country of Issuance
- Alien Identification Card Number
- Number and Country of Issuance of any other Government-Issued Document evidencing nationality or residence and bearing a photograph or similar safeguard

We sincerely apologize if one or more of the above mentioned documents were provided to us but denied at the time of your account opening. Please still consider AU Credit Union as a trusted financial institution in your local area, and contact memberservices@aufcu.org about reapplying for membership with one or more of the documents listed above.

name: scott hamil
text: Have been a customer for years. Staff has always been professional and courteous.

Other lady comes over and tells me they are going to have to put a 4 day hold on my check (under $300).  I told them no, close my account.  Other lady walks away and the teller is standing there staring off into space.  Other lady comes back, and she says yes he wants to close the account, (I had been standing there for 5 minutes.)  This place needs qualified people, not kids who like to play around.  And Baye, grow some brains.

name: Morg B.
text: Dont go off of Google's hours of operation for drive through,  the correct opening hours for drive through is a 9:30 opening.

resp.text: We apologize for the delayed response due to the disabling of this functionality by Google and continued high volumes associated with COVID-19. We would like the opportunity to help. If you still need assistance, please email HLSocial@wellsfargo.com with additional details, and I'll do my best to ensure this matter is addressed. Be sure to include your Google username, and refrain from sharing account or loan numbers. Thank you for your time. -Shaun, Wells Fargo HL Social

resp.text: I apologize for any inconvenience, Matthew. We have changed operating hours and temporarily closed a number of locations for the safety of our customers and employees. Please visit https://www.wellsfargo.com/locator/ for up-to-date branch availability and hours. If you’d like to discuss your concerns further, please feel free to email us at HLSocial@wellsfargo.com (no account numbers). -AJ, Wells Fargo HL Social

text: This place is sketchy anyways but Google says open 24/7. As two females, alone, we pull up to fill up each of our vehicles to return one to the airport and one to head back home. This isn’t the best part of town anyways but to have the lights turned off on you in the middle of filling up at 830 at night will definitely make you aware of your surroundings. Not to mention there were two men standing outside the store off to the side as well. Just very unprofessional and I am still trying to wrap my mind around why the lights were shut off on us during business hours.

Thank you Compass Bank!!

text: By far the worst bank I have ever been to. After waiting in line for 15 minutes, the teller conveniently announced that she is leaving for lunch. I am shocked the management is so nonchalant about the behavior of the tellers.

name: Douglas Brock
text:
Let me get this right.  There is a data breach at one of YOUR vendors so you shut down access with ZERO notification.  Then you want to charge me for replacements because YOUR VENDOR had a data breach.  Then after waiting 2 weeks for a card you completely shut down the old card once again with NO NOTIFICATION and your reaction is aww so sorry we will send you another that might get there in 2 weeks as well. UNBELIEVABLE!!!  It was Compass' issue and they should of had a new card to me overnight at no charge, period.

FYI anyone wanting to do a mortgage there watch out, their underwriters will put you aside if a bigger deal comes in.  Tacked on an additional week.  Strait from the underwriters mouth.

If there was a zero stars rating they would get it.

name: Stella Standifer
text:
Two weeks ago, yesterday, I had to forfeit my bank card because a young employee at Sprint Mart in Columbus MS made a bad decision to use my card to pay her cable and power bill. When out of town and I have no access to a bank - I have money waiting on me in PayPal, but because my only way to get paid is through my bank card, I can’t get it.  Am I being unreasonable to believe that my card should have been in my hands two days ago?

Yesterday, 10:00 a.m., I called the credit union to find out what date my bank card was ordered.  I was told that the person who ordered it had stepped out and would call me later. No return call, so I called again today to speak to that person.  She said that the only person who could order the card was on vacation and would be back Tuesday. AND then I was informed that My name was NOT on the list in which replacement cards had been ordered!  😳😠😤😡😭😭😭

name: Logan Powell
text: Staff is very nice. However, this bank is a little dated. The way things are done and the way the accounts update is how things were done 20 years ago. Your account does not update as it should for sometimes 3 days after you make a purchase, if you make purchases on the weekends, it doesn't show up until Monday, and, your account will not update until theu open. Most banks provide instant updates of your account information. Just a lot of hassle. Overdraft fees are kind of high too.

So how do I find out what is going on with my name ? The letter was sent to my home address in bowman , ga. They have to have some help with their own bank it seems to me.

name: Bruce Johnson
text:
Took advantage of a great rate on a CD 12 months ago.  I electronically sent them the funds.  My funds cleared within 3 days.  That was a year ago.  The WEBSITE offers no way to manage the CD.  There is no way to close the account at maturity.  They instructed me to

HAND PRINT A LETTER WITH MY NAME, ACCOUNT No. PREFERRED DISTRIBUTION, COPY OF MY DL, all Notorized so I can FAX it to their location, and in RETURN<>>>>  THEY WILL MAIL ME A CHECK!!

CLOWNS.

DO NOT DO BUSINESS with this bank!!

name: Eugene Barrett
text: A family member banked here on a loan, They passed away. I can't get them on the phone to close the account(all bills after deceased do not fall on the living, only the death bills). They won't allow me the time to get the details needed to properly close this. Very unprofessional hanging up on me at every call.

name: Brian Krueger
text:
WARNING to anyone considering opening a Money Market account at BBVA because of the advertised high rate...DON’T DO IT!!!! DO NOT FALL VICTIM to their deceptive marketing practices and awful customer service.

I haven’t fully closed my account yet, but will give you just one example of why this bank is so dysfunctional. I had to drive two hours from my house in Georgia to the closest physical BBVA branch in Oxford, Alabama to access my funds on Saturday over Memorial Day weekend to get access to my money to purchase a car.

From account opening, to what I imagine will be the same experience at account closing, this whole process has been a nightmare.

Management is truly oblivious and does not care about customer experience when the bank is advertising how wonderful their customer experience is, but literally EVERYTHING is difficult to do unless you go to a physical branch.

Why the hell offer a nation-wide money market account special when I can even access my funds because there aren’t any branches of the bank in my state.

I sent in over 6 complaints through various methods and have continued to have problems to this day.

Note to the bank: don’t both posting a response about how sorry you are and saying please contact us so we can help you. This is just a public relations stunt to try and save face. Fix your awful systems and processes, that’s all the information you need from me.

name: Ashanti Thomas
text: I was greeted when I first came through the door and immediately was directed to help. Ashley was phenomenal!!!!!! She was so friendly and seemed interested in helping me with whatever I needed. Glad I decided to bank here.

name: Jack Johnson
text: This bank is a great one to have when you live in Montgomery, AL. They are a credit union which means you get all the benefits of being a smaller home town bank. When you go there in person, which is rare because they have such a robust app, they always greet you with a smile and allow you to grab a fresh coffee or water if you have to wait.  They offer great rates on auto and home loans. Check them out if you live in the Gump.

name: Tara Smith
text: Max is the best bank in the river region.

name: William McNeel
text:
