name: Jessica Heyer
text:
BEWARE!!  CARD SKIMMER ON CREDIT CARD MACHINE AT THE REGISTER INSIDE THE STORE.
When I used my debit card at this store on July 17, 2018, I was required to enter my pin # two times- once at the beginning of the transaction and again at the end of the transaction. I Asked the cashier why I was required to enter my pin twice and she quickly looked away nervously and didn't respond. I then turned the machine and looked closely at the side where cards are swiped. The machine appeared to have an overlay that had been mounted to the credit card machine. When I looked up, the cashier looked away quickly and would not make eye contact.

The following day, July 18, I began to see fraudulent charges posting to my bank account. I reported the charges to regions and was told by the bank manager that it appeared that someone had cloned my debit card. Regions is opening an investigation into the fraud.

TO THE OWNER OF THIS STORE-
YOUR EMPLOYEE (white female with brown hair, approx late 30s to 40s) that was working the register on July 17, 2018 around 1pm is a thief!!
If she stole from me, she'll steal from you and the rest of your customers!!

resp.text:
Thank you Erin for your review.  I am looking into this situation and please know that I take this issue  very serious.  I would love to speak to you to acquire more details . Country Convenience has never had this happen before.
Thank You   Patti Middleton  251-964-5674  or 251-747-7581

text: I had some problems with unauthorized charges on my account so I went in to seek help.  The two ladies that helped me could not have been nicer. Everything was handled and professionally. It took almost no time to get new account number and debit card.  Thank you Redstone Federal Credit Union.  You alleviated my stress quickly.

name: carolyn cole
text: The lady we just had at the branch on Sullivan street was extremely rude and very unprofessional.  If you work with public you need to have good work ethic and know how to speak to people. She didnt even look at my sons account before she said "sorry cant help you!" He was going to pay off a loan then apply for a stretch loan which is what the branch manager lady told him two months ago, then this lady  said that my son had to get another checking account and have it for  three months before he "could even" apply for any loan at Redstone. Then she said once that other loan is paid off he cant apply for nothing for  three months.  That is not what he was told originally.  Yall all need to get your story straight and be on the same page. We will be withdrawing all our money our of our accounts from your bank and take our business elsewhere.  If I could have given her a zero she sure deserves it.

name: Sherrie Villamil
text: Zero stars rating.  I wanted to help my son by co-signing on a loan for a car but was told that there was an outstanding loan amount that was due that I had cosigned on with my ex about 25 years earlier.  The loan officer said that in order to get a loan with them I would have to pay this loan off.  It was $1400.  So, I went to my parents who agreed to loan me the money.  Keep in mind that they are on a fixed income and I would not have asked if I did not believe I could recoup the amount quickly.  Well, long story short, I paid it off and then was told, "I'm sorry, we cannot loan you any money at this time."  One, that old loan should have been charged off during my ex's bankruptcy ages before. Two, that loan was charged off.  It was not shown on anyone's credit report.  Not mine nor my ex husbands.  Regardless, I will never do business with them if I can avoid it.  They tried to do the same with my brother.  He told them if it was not shown on his credit reports he would not pay and he walked out.  I am sure this has happened to more people.  I wish they would speak up.

text:
Absolutely the worst experience!!! I have had a Regions account for many years and I have never been treated this way.

Went in to cash a check from my 401k and they refused to cash my check. They stated they could not verify the funds, even though I could contact my company and verify the check. The individuals I dealt with refused to speak to the them. They called "operations back office" and they said they could not cash or deposit my check into my account. I honestly felt like I was treated like a criminal.

I was able to go to another branch in Alabaster, and worked with the Assistant Branch Manager, Nicole Robinson. She was amazing!! Not only were we in and out less than 20 minutes. She had no need to call anyone to verify my check. She was an absolute pleasure and made me feel like my business was worthy of being a member of Regions.

Customer Service here absolutely blows!  They make you feel unwelcome and unwanted.

I was forced to return to another branch several miles away.  Great job Regions!  Way to make an impact!

name: E
text: Denied my car loan application when I needed it most because I haven’t “been on my job long enough.” As a registered nurse who is in high demand during a pandemic, I’m sure that I will maintain my job to pay a car note. Also, they did not verify my source of income by requesting a pay stub to see how much I actually make or check loan payment history. I have never been late on a payment for my home or student loans. She did not offer another solution to my request. They are not friendly at this branch nor do they offer solutions to maximize your saving. The lack of staff diversity is also saddening. Very disappointed and I will be closing my account.

name: Susan Johnson
text:
I have been a member of this Credit Union for fifty (50) years; and I have never been treated like I was at this branch. I have gone to the Homewood Branch for 50 years, and could not today because it is temporarily closed.

As I entered the Branch I was motioned to go up to a window that had a table in front of it. I understand the Covid regulations; however, when I asked to see the manager three times, I was denied. She (Angela) came back from lunch and sat at her desk waiting on no one. I asked repeatedly if I could go to her desk and sit for two reasons: I’m suffering from hamstring tendinitis; and I had four things that needed to be handled, and it is painful to stand for long periods of time.

The young man at the counter said he could help me; even though he kept asking for help. That is one reason I kept asking for the manager, to speed up the process. I came to fill out a “dispute charges” form ( he could not do that), get a temporary debit card,  because I was told to cut mine up by someone at the Alabaster location.

The cashier at the counter began to ask for my personal information (account number and last four digits of my SS number) in a loud voice and expected me to holler my personal information from 6 Ft away. Talk about identity theft, let’s just tell everyone in the lobby! I was appalled that he cared more about germs than securing my personal identity. I asked to write info on a piece of paper.

Then he obviously did not know how to dispute charges, again asking for help. Now Angela gets up to go assist him. She never introduced herself to me, apologize to me for delay or inconvenience. They huddled in a corner of Branch long enough for me to ask if there was a problem. This young man was oblivious as to what to do. Angela finished the transaction, and then they were ready for me to leave. I again asked for a temporary debit card, cash and checkbook cover.

I taught Business Education in Jefferson County for 32 years, and none of these employees would have passed in my classes.  They need to improve on human relations, how to treat customers, and how to show kindness to older people, especially ones who say they are disabled.

I will probably have to return to this branch, if Homewood isn’t open. If I do, I hope I see some changes.

name: Orlando Chandler
text: I am very disappointed, the web site is always down and they don't answer there phone, I will be looking for another credit union as soon as possible. Nice and polite does not pay my bills in emergency situation.

name: DawnMarie 223
text: Would give 0 stars if I could. I have been banking with ECO for 10 years and never had a problem. Recently I went through a divorce and had the banker Blake at this location remove my ex from my accounts. DO NOT DO ANY TRANSACTIONS WITH HIM. He doesn’t know what he is doing. Even another worker at another location told me he did it incorrectly. He only took my ex off of the checking and not the savings even after I told him to remove from both. I was not aware that he only fixed my checking & My ex was then able to wipe all of my money out of my savings account through transferring it to his personal account.  The bank says even though it was a banker error, I have lost my money and there is nothing they can do but ask him to give the money back which he of course will not do. I have tried to get in touch with the head manager over the branches & I have left messages  to no avail. Since there are no repercussions for the bankers actions  I will be closing both of my accounts as well as both of my sons’ savings accounts here.

name: Elmira Richburg
text: I absolutely LOVE this credit union!  Everyone in there is so personable and truly cares about you.  The branch manger Kelley, is AWESOME!!!! She goes above and beyond to help clients.  We've financed multiple cars with them, refinanced cars, had business accounts open, personal accounts.. you name it, we've done it, and Kelley and the rest of the team at this branch has made it happen with ease!   We now live in Texas, and refuse to leave them!  We will always have an account with Eco, for sure as long as Kelley Calhoun is there!  If you want a personal banking experience and are tired of the cookie cutter big baking experience, go see Kelley or one of her team members at Eco in Riverchase!

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Elmira! We are so thankful that you choose to bank with eCO Credit Union, even from afar!

name: Brandon Lee Majors
text: Every experience I have with eCO Credit Union reminds me why, for over a decade, I haven't considered looking for another place for any of my financial needs. The personal touch and attention, while an integral part of everything they do, only serves to complete a near flawless experience and execution in every other area. If you live in the areas they service and aren't a member then you are missing out.

text: I started using this gas station within the last 2 years. In the past I never really cared for the location tho now I'm not sure why. I rarely go elsewhere.  Their icee's are fire,  they carry Tastycake powdered donuts, nice selection of wine- I'm kinda assuming this.  I know nothing about wine but they have a bunch of different ones so I figured the possibility was high. The employees are super nice. One lady (who loves Alabama football) did me an absolute solid. "I" accidently left my 4yo's cup in the store while she was working. I had no idea.  Searched everywhere (I thought) for 2 days.  We have other cups, too many actually but he prefers the one abandoned. Can't blame him,  I have my own cup that no others can live up to. I get it. We went back to the store on day 2. While checking out she says "oh yeah" or something of the sort. She walks away, comes back with cup while telling me I'd left it. Glad she cleared that up cause home invasion had popped in my mind. It is a Cars cup after all. I apologize to Trussville PD explaining false alarm and hang up. That's a joke, they have me blocked. Anyway, I thank her a bunch, tell her how happy I am to have it, 4yo says "thank you" cause he should. I'll allow note taking just this once. We leave, I hear something fall off car. I stop and back up only to hear a crunch. It's pretty loud. Reluctantly I step out of the vehicle and start laughing hoping to lighten the blow. I ran over my chips. Didn't see that coming did you. Deuces.

I mean the position requires top notch customer service...actually, I'm lying,  it doesn't even require "good customer service", bc customer service doesn't take much effort at all!! If you are even the slightest bit capable to understand how to smile, respond to a question with that smile, and be available to do YOUR job, like YOU were hired to do when YOU APPLIED (no one asked you to apply for the position...especially when you are not capable to atleast do those extremely simple things/requirements), then, anyone, who is anyone, can work in customer service if they allow themselves to be genuine. Anyone will easily  outshine  the current employees. As well as, a difference in profits will most likely  be seen, bc these current employees obviously are  not fit one bit due to their lack of simple professionalism.  As long as ive lived here, in Theodore, I've only come across 2 girls that are not part of the problem. 1 of the 2 girls still wrk there,  and she was working on the 1st as well but she was off by 8pm. The gas station could be a 5 star, but the ppl chosen to be the face of your location, are far from great choices.. unfortunately !! if it's employees weren't so extremely rude, lazy, and unprofessional & theyd look at you like you're literally stupid because you asked a question they don't feel like responding to, like you're interrupting their damn day!. He begrudgingly gave me my change, but no receipt, so I am still not sure if he shorted me a bit.
Go down the street to another spot.  I am crossing this place off my list.

name: Jon marsh
text: I started a small business and I make glass globe plant life. So the last few payments have been by check (which is fine)  I never experienced the type of rudeness I received like I did the other day from a teller. I've been cashing the checks through my wells Fargo account mostly and others I have cashed inside the bank I received the check from, to see if I want another account with another bank. (Walking in regions) waited 10 mins to even see a teller due to them being busy(3 customers 2 tellers) yeah that was sarcasm.  When it was finally my turn I told the cashier I need to cash this check. She responded ok I need your LICENSE  to which I provided while I signed the back of the check. Of forgot to mention this is a $25.oo check. She asked if I had an account with regions I responded no mam. She said you are aware their is a service fee on checks if you do not have an account with regions. I said no I didn't know that, that's weird. I said how much, she replied 2 dollars (not much it seems but when you struggle to make ends meet that $2 means a lot) she said yes it's just our policy " EVERYONE GETS CHARGED THE FEE IF YOU ARE NOT AN ACCOUNT HOLDER" I said ok, my bank doesn't do that. When I write a check to someone they cash without having an account with my bank it bc that's their hard earned money. She responded "well the only way I cannot charge you is if the check HOLDER gives permission to WAIVE the fee. So naturally I was pissed off. I said how is it you can say that it's a mandatory fee and EVERONE GETS CHARGED THAT FEE IF NOT AN ACCOUNT HOLDER, but if the check HOLDER called and said it's ok to WAIVE the fee. That literally makes no sense! She replied in a smart tone "well why don't you just deposit it to your wells account. I said I'm almost out of gas and just figured I could cash it here being less than a mile from my house. I said fine just cash it I'm on my way to work. I will be visiting the branch manager of regional manager tomorrow to see exactly why they say it's mandatory but it can be waived? I'm in customer service I know what it's like dealing with the public but that was uncalled for rudeness. I will recommend everyone close their account bc my friend did the day I told her what happened she said she had no idea they did this when she paid ppl by check and was outraged. So that's 1 account being closed. 1 may not matter much to this bank but I have only told her so far so next is other friends who msg me about their accounts with them.

text:
We were traveling from illinois to the race in Talladega and the other motorhome in our group started having problems so they limped into Cowboys! The owner took it upon his self to actually call a mechanic friend of his at 430 in the afternoon "gary the mechanic" showed up and after some diagnosing decided it need an alternator so right there in the parking lot he took the old one iff and went to the parts store. Came back put the new one on in the parking lot of Cowboys and we continued our trip to the race. Mike the owner of Cowboys and his mechanic friend Gary Brown with their "southern hospitality" went above and beyond what most everyday people would have done for us esp in the late afternoon. He even offered for us in both motorhomes to stay the night"free" on his lot . We are so grateful for the 2 of you. Thank your for your kindness and hospitality! I would highly recommendthis station to anyone!

Robb Reeser

name: Jennifer Turney
text: They have horrible customer service. Every month, it is like pulling teeth to get them to actually take a payment on an auto loan. There is always something. This month, they’re not allowed to speak with me about my husband’s auto loan. We have given written permission several times, not to mention, this isn’t a problem each month. I have spoken to other representatives about the account before. However, this month it was a problem. I know our payment amount, however, the rep would not confirm that the amount I gave was correct. I also asked if we were on a paperless billing cycle with them since we did not receive a statement this month and she refused to answer. When questioned, she stated her department can’t speak to me about the account but other departments can. Seriously?? This is just one of the many reasons I hate making this call every month. We also have to pay $10 for them to take our payment over the phone. We refuse to mail a check because they will “lose it” and we will be charged more fees. We are not close to a branch and can’t make it to a drive thru without being inconvenienced. So, we pay them to take our money each month. Do yourself a favor and use another bank for your auto loan or any other banking needs.

resp.text:
Thank you for reaching out, Jennifer. We would like to apologize that your experience has not been up to our Guardian standards, and hope we can speak with you further about this.

An alternative to paying your loan payment over the phone is using Guardian's Free Mobile App to make a loan payment. Visit  http://bit.ly/GuardianDigitalSolutions for more information, or feel free to reach out to our team at 334-244-9999 to speak with one of our team members about this.

Thank you for allowing us to serve you.

DO NOT TRUST THIS BANK!!!

name: The Dude
text:
Shortly after​ their purchase of the previous bank, Wachovia  My identity was stolen the day after i opened the account, which was done in person at the district branch, no less. Now they want ME to ASSUME RESPONSIBILIT for the debt with the promise of being compensated later...... BUT ONLY IF the "THIEF"(mind you) pays them back through a NON-COURT ORDER​ED RESTITUTION process (In other words, doesn't legally have to pay back the money even though they caught the guy red handed because of his photo being taken at an off site ATM he tried to rob ,while heavily intoxicated. He might have got away with it but he was QUICKLY found thanks to the store clerk that was able to easily ID HIM BEING THEY WERE ROOMMATES! They both share the residence in back of the lot behind the very store they were standing in....
I'm not paying Wells Fargo a dime.... They are arguably as incompetent as the moron who stole my identity by going through the dumpster behind my office...Or so he says.

text: Cindy answered the phone and was the opposite of helpful and when I told her that, it was very obvious she didn't care. I just started my auto loan, and NO ONE has been helpful since I do not bank with Tydall. I do not recommend using Tyndall so far. Hope this changes.

name: NAs NAs
text: This new setup is a disaster, no deposit slips, no way of telling whose turn it is if there are a bunch of people waiting. Fewer tellers than they should have, the staff is nice, but this setup, whoever thought about it does not make any sense. If you go in during lunchtime then good luck.

name: iamTHATGUY uknow
text: Love the people

name: Peter Zahel
text: My son deposited his first paycheck to his Regions account on Friday. According to teller the check should be cleared by Saturday. Since my son didnt see any deposit on his account by Monday morning we have contacted the bank with an inquiry. Regions told us they (teller) deposited the check check to a wrong account. It is Wednesday afternoon and my son still doesn't have his money. Regions bank refusing to credit his account immediately until they will resolve the situation internally. Shame on them and shame on such a business practice. If we would make an error our account would be charged with monumental fees. Regions bank pretty much stole my son's money and gave it to someone else. Still waiting for resolution. We have the deposit ticket from the bank in hands..... Sounds like a material for an attorney to look at. DON'T BANK WITH REGIONS.

name: Don Baker
text: Didn't have any activity in my business account for a bit, and Regions closed it without notifying me.  My customers were depositing payments to this account.  Now I have to try and explain this to my customers, and find another bank.

name: Grey Peterson
text: They should have a sign on the door "If you are in a hurry then don't come inside". First time experience at this location. There were several cars in drive thru so I thought it would be quicker to go in (I only had one deposit to make). Parking lot was full but got lucky with one space. Walked in and three people sitting in chairs right inside door, all employees busy with customers, two empty computers with no employees. I really didn't  know what to do when I walked in. I asked the customers sitting if they were waiting for a teller and they said yes so I noted who was in front of me and stood and waited. One customer got frustrated and left so now two in front of me. Two more came in and walked ahead of us and I kindly said that we were waiting for a teller, too. They were nice, one left and the other sat down and waited. The two in front of me were there because they had wrongful credits to their account so they would be a while, too. They all said that the wait was common at this location. I stood there for 20 minutes before I finally got waited on.  The teller was nice and started to chat with me ( I was in a hurry, on my lunch and frustrated) and there was was still one person behind me. I told him that I was in a hurry and had already waited 20 minutes to please just deposit my check.  He then tried to tell me that I could have used the machine outside and or gone through the drive thru (he was still very nice). I was not. I told him I thought it would be quicker to come inside that I had never waited this long with just 2 people ahead of me.  He said that he thought it was normal to wait at all banks.  He stayed professional but I know I made him mad at the end because his smile went away. It wasn't his fault. Evidently they have a new policy that you can go to any teller for anything, opening an account, lost card, wrongful credits to your account, all of which take a long time so if you want to cash a check or make a simple deposit then don't go inside. I did hear that the drive thru is pretty quick even with a line.

name: Erik Hartwig
text:
Getting in and out of this location is a complete disaster, especially if you go at lunch time with everyone trying to get to Chick-Fil-A and the Honey Baked Ham store, and parking is horrendous.  They also have a new and weird layout inside that doesn't feel secure or that security is their number 1 priority, it feels more like a cell phone store.  Computer screens that your transactions are happening on are 100% visible to anyone close by.

The staff is friendly though.

text: This is "The Spot" at the center of Brookwood. The guys that work here are always nice and remember you when you come in. The local kids meet up here and stop by before school for their biscuits, and after school for snacks. I believe they're now open 24/7, which is great in this town which is home of many coal mines and Mercedes-Benz USI and it's suppliers, which in turn means that people are going and coming to and from work at all hours of the day and night. A store open at 24/7 is a GREAT CONVENIENCE. Much appreciated!

text: I've been doing business with the Citizens Bank here since I was a just a kid, my father and I have been taking care of that big side yard next to it for as long as I can remember, we mow the grass up there. The folks here at the bank are all as nice as they can be, they all know me by first name as well. A good small-town bank that I am very happy to have an account with~

name: Justin Nix
text: This is a great place to do business. The people are all nice and courteous. I feel like family everytime I enter the doors.

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text:
Wow...unsure of who the "friendly dark-haired lady" was that apparently thought that ME- a white, blonde-headed woman in a Honda was a terrorist ready to break into your "old hat" bank in the morning as they opened. I live almost 2 hours from here, and once per month I drive a long way to have an appointment at a nearby salon...so near you can see it from the bank. I arrived early and they were mowing and weed eating all around the parking lot to the salon which wasn't open yet, so I parked at the nearby bank at 7:30 in an area where other cars were parked and it had a covering overhead, which helped with the sun, and I also used the space at the end- the furtherest parking space from the door. Well, when the employees started coming in there was one lady that wouldn't stop staring me down as if I were a member of Al Qaeda waiting to rush in and rob the bank, and looking at me extremely rude. She stared me down all the way until she got to the door to unlock it and then just stood there with the door open staring at me more (smart thing to do if you think there's a security risk going on). I didn't think much of it because I was minding my own business and eating a biscuit and looking down at my phone most of the time. But then I look up again and she had an entire clan of people looking at me (employees who had arrived and were standing outside of their cars in the parking lot); she was looking at them in the parking lot as if they shouldn't try to walk into the bank because me, *the possible big bad mean bank robber* might try to rush them. I'm a person sitting here waiting for a business to open and I've actually sat in the same exact parking spot 5-6 times before without any issue. Once I realized what was going on I saw a man walking over to my car and I rolled down my window, and I explained to him what I was doing and that after using THEIR ATM I was just waiting on a business to open. He then said that they just weren't sure what I was up to.

I will say, just based on this incident I am so glad I am not a customer of your bank. I understand having to have security, but this isn't it. I don't know what happened to small town courtesy, hospitality and friendliness but it certainly doesn't reside here. I used your ATM, but that's one fee you'll never get from me again.

text: No communication til week of construction loan due date, then said was due even though had had 1 extension prior & city permits were out of our control.  Also, if you need your online password reset or any other customer service over the weekend, they’re closed so forget it. Their equity line checks are exactly like their regular checking checks, so be very careful to differentiate. Their staff is very nice and helpful, though.

resp.text: Kim we are sorry you have had a bad experience with us. We do have three branches that are open on weekends and a 24 hour help line. We appreciate your feedback and will work to provide a better experience in these areas.

text: Excellent experience with them.  I love the banking side.  I also have done a mortgage loan through them at an excellent rate and customer service.  Highly recommend.

name: Will Payne
text: We have only been banking with Avadian for a few months, but we have been very impressed with their service and products. Never a long wait at the drive thru or inside at the teller. Accounts were quick and easy to open. Fair rates and fees. Staff are all very nice and know you by name. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Will! We are delighted you decided to join us. Have a fantastic weekend!

name: Ivonne Campbell
text: I am a customer of Avadian and I love banking with them.  They provide amazing customer service.  When I come in, everyone greets me by name and I know their names too.  When the branch transitioned from American Bank of Huntsville to Avadian , I must admit things took a little time to get re-aligned.  After the transition it has been smooth sailing.  They offered me an amazing interest rate on my car loan and made it a super convenient buying experience.  You receive your debit card on the spot and they are compatible with Apple Pay.

name: Chris Clark
text: I walked in today to do a deposit and was very rudely confronted by a male employee saying I am required to wear a mask "in his branch." I will be moving my business to another financial institution and closing my accounts ASAP.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear you had a bad experience. We aren’t requiring masks in our branch but they are encouraged for the safety of our staff and our members. We will speak with the branch staff regarding this.

name: DeAnne Daniels
text: I love banking with Avadian. They are all about customer service. I moved here from Birmingham and followed Avadian all the way. Have been a loyal customer for 8+ years. Checking,  savings, everything I need.

resp.text: Thank you for the review DeAnne!!

name: David McCurry
text: Heather Burrough and John Starnes at Cadence Bank have helped several of my clients with estate and conservatorship accounts.  Not all banks will offer these services and I'm thankful that they have the expertise and knowledge to do so.  They are very professional and easy to work with.  I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Brian Smith
text: Heather and her staff have always been super accommodating, polite, and respectful. If you are looking for a relationship with your bank and not just being looked at as another number I would highly recommend Cadence Bank downtown Huntsville.

If you’d like, you may send your name and phone number to social@cadencebank.com so we can have someone get in touch with you directly to discuss your experience. text:
Very low-key gas station in the middle of nowhere. This was the last road trips. We want to take on the way back from New Orleans to Tennessee but when you need gas you need gas.

Definitely your typical gas station with low Lighting in very shady at night. This is one of those gas stations you would prefer if you were the only one there when getting out of the car. The cashier at the time was very uneducated on the surroundings and could not help us with anything.

As far as interior gifts items to buy excetera this gas station had more than enough and we did not have problem buying snacks water and using the restroom. Definitely go in and out if possible and hopefully come out safe. Godspeed gents.

On the plus side if you happen to get hungry there is a Little Caesars attached on the left side. I don't know if they have corresponding hours but during normal hours "Pizza Pizza"

P.S. bring a spare flashlight

name: Charles Hickerson
text: Paid 20 dollars for gas,  went to pump it and they put it on the wrong pump.  Someone pumped the gas I paid for,  after they swiped their card. (Swiping your card after having gas paid for doesn't cancel the cash payment or charge their card.) I went inside to ask if I had paid for the pump I was on.  Wound up losing my 20 dollars,  no compensation,  no refund.  Whoever they called said there was nothing they could do. The moral of the story is if you wanna use your comdata card go to the pilot down the road until they learn how to use it

text: I don't think I could ever say enough good things about this bank! They go above and beyond for their customers!! We have been using this bank for little or a year now and yesterday was a sure sign we are with the right people! We traveled out of town to West Virginia and back of course we used our debit cards on our trip. We came home an my husband tried to use his debit card at the store and it was declined, he gave them cash an went on his way. He makes it to his truck an our bank called to inform him that someone tried to use his debit card in New York, and as soon as they saw that charge they froze his card. Then asked if he would like one mailed or he could pick it up next day at our local branch. We had no idea this had happened, but these awesome people stopped it before we even knew we had any problems!! If this is not great banking and customer service I don't know what is!!! Thank you guys!!!!

Once I am financially able to I will be getting out of it and never using your bank ever again for anything.

WELLS FARGO IS TERRIBLE

But No, cannot do, have to fill out papers and mail the check to Loss Prevention. WTH!
LETS MAKE THIS PROCESS AS HARD AS POSSIBLE.
LETS WASTE MORE OF OUR TIME.
AND NO!
I DO NOT WANT A  CHECKING ACCOUNT, SO QUIT ASKING.

text: I went through the drive thru this morning. Th lady who waited on me has waited on me many times and by now should know me. I gave her the deposits and my bank card.  5 minutes later she asked me for my I’d. I gave it her. It took her 20 plus minutes to process my deposit.  She was the only one working three drive though lanes. Apparently she quit working on mine to assist others who pulled in after me. This is completely unacceptable and I made it known to the other person standing there twiddling her thumbs. No wonder they only receive 3 star rating. I gave them 1 star.  Terrible customer service

text: Not happy at all. Went to deposit a check today, a wells Fargo logo check, and was asked if I wanted to cash it all or deposit. Well I do not like walking around with a lot of cash, so I got a little and deposited the rest. I needed the entire amount today for various things for my kids and myself. It's my birthday. Not one time through out the transaction did the teller say that the funds wouldn't be available til tomorrow. Once I realized that it wouldn't be, I drove back up there to talk to the manager. They said it had been over an hour so they couldn't help me!! If I would've known the funds wouldn't be available til tomorrow, I would've cashed it and deposited the cash. Why can they cash the entire thing and not deposit the entire thing? And I've done this before and got my funds right away. They have ruined my birthday.

resp.text:
Sorry that you didn’t enjoy your experience, though I am unsure you were at The RiverPub at Cliff’s Landing.
Our Baldwin County Department of Health score is 100 and publicly posted. Also, the only food we serve are “frozen” pizza, burgers, and assorted chips. We are a drinking establishment not a restaurant. We open our SandBar each spring & have a tiki bar and “beach sand.” We don’t have a volleyball court, Tropics (located about 15 minutes south of us) on the Causeway does. I fear you may have confused our businesses.
Respectfully,
The RiverPub at Cliff’s Landing

text: Horrible customer service! I have never been treated so poorly by a bank. Preston is unprofessional and untrustworthy. I deposited a check through the atm - he called me the following day to tell me that because of the amount and the fact it was a personal check they were putting a 10 day hold on my funds. The check cleared the payee's account the following day. Not only did he hold the funds from me for 10 days - he attempted to hold them for an additional 4 more and told ME (the customer) to provide him proof that the check cleared. The Hoover branch is SO helpful and considerate - I wont stop at this branch again EVER!

name: Shirley Williams
text: I had great experience with this program it led me straight to American First Federal Credit Union with time to spare 💖💖💖

name: brian collins
text:
Today I closed my accounts at America's First after having been a member for over 35 years.  I've tried to be patient, understanding that they are a smaller institution and lack the systems and experience of larger institutions but it finally became too much to tolerate.  It's been a comedy of ineptitude, bad systems and offensive behavior.

My account was originally a solo account and we added my wife to the account when we got married almost 30 years ago.  The Credit Union kept losing or failing to acknowledge that document.  I must have added her as a fully authorized user and joint owner on the account over five times through the years.  Once, they wouldn't allow her to pay off a loan saying she wasn't authorized to make payments on a loan we took out together.

My children have each been stranded out of town with no access to their cash when the credit union froze their accounts suspecting their travel meant fraud.  In each case, the credit union was notified prior to their trips and they still locked their accounts.  In each case, it was over a weekend and they were unable to remove the block until a business day.  One child was in New York City with no cash for food, taxi, subway.  The other was in Minnesota.  Our only choice was to wire our kids cash via Western Union.

Our accounts have been compromised at least 3 times where someone other than us had an AmFirst issued card with our account information and gone on shopping sprees.  In each case the onus was on us to prove we didn't make the purchase, and we had to wait for weeks to be refunded but the credit union refused to give us any case information so we could bring charges against the criminal or even go to police.  They said the fraud was against them, not us.

A fraudster gained access to our son's account and he drove to America's First to report the problem.  They refused to lock his card saying they couldn't verify he wasn't making the out of state purchases as he stood there in the branch.  He stood there with the banker as they watched purchase after purchase drain his account down to zero.

The final straw was me taking a cashiers check from my investment broker to deposit in my Americas First account.  It was a sizable check but not the first time I'd moved funds between the accounts.  AmFirst said they would have to freeze my funds for 10 business days to make sure the check was good.  They said they had never seen a check from Merrill Lynch and didn't know what to do with it.  I said they could call my broker to verify.  The banker then accused me of attempting felony fraud.  She didn't know if it was a real check and even if it was, I could cash the check then drive to my broker to remove the funds.  I was stunned.  After a 35ish year relationship with Americas First, I'm suddenly going to start passing fraudulant financial instruments?

No more.  I'm done with them.

text: I have been a wells Fargo coustomer for 20 years. Three years ago I opened a business account. Recently I opened another business. Its a sole proprietorship. I am not sure what you are looking for I have them all. Long story short REGIONS  now has this new enity. And will have the other and my personal  next week. You should hire knowledgeable  people. In a sole proprietorship  you sometimes only have a city or county licence.  And it is all thats required to open a bank account with your DL and SSN  which both were presented

name: William Brooks
text: Call the bank , introduced myself, indicated that I had a checking account with the bank and was interested in a small loan $5000+ for twelve months.  Girl said well we would have to run a credit check and interest would be between 9.9% and 22%.  You would think that they might would check to see how much money I had in their bank, what my current credit rating was (they provide this monthly to me) and even see what they could do to make this a painless procedure??  No, cut and dried!!  Will be moving my account to another bank as soon as I can.

resp.text: I’m sorry we weren’t able to meet your expectations, William. Please email me at HLSocial@wellsfargo.com with your Google username and any other concerns you may have, and I’ll do my best to address them (no account numbers). name: Alan Daniel
text: Tried to  deposit  cash into my wife's  checking  account . Teller  informed  me  she could  not  take a cash deposit because I didn't  have her id. It's  funny that the ATM didn't  complain  about  the  same  cash. Just another  reason  why I  changed banks.

name: Alicia Shah
text: They act a little snobby there,  not all of them, but enough for me to not go except on Saturdays and ONLY if i really got to.  Also,  i run a business and 1 time i went to get a bunch of rolled coins.  Once given to me, there was NO way i could carry all them rolled coins and 5s, 1s, 10s, etc without something to put them in.  But,  the teller looked at me,  waiting for me to collect and go.. when i asked for something to put them in i got looked at funny and she said they had nothing to put them in and thought i brought something to put them in.  This was all last second for me,  i didn't know i needed all that till i got a call from an employee of mine... so, after explaining how the NICE ladies at the other branch usually give me an empty coin box to use,  magically she came up with an empty penny box.  But,  also didn't bother to help me fill it up either.  The branch one jefferson street is so much better!! Love the ladies over there! They do EVERYTHING they can to make life so much easier on me,  while wearing a REAL smile on their faces! Too bad i got to go today... they really should open the jefferson branch on Saturdays, might get a little more business... just sayin...

name: Joe Mallory
text: We have had trouble several times just trying to deposit checks into our checking account! It seems one particular teller in the drive through is responsible for this! If we where going to cash a check written to us and keep the money I could see a little more but going into our checking account I donot understand! It has got to the point we are going to another bank after 20 years with ya'll!

name: LaTisha Byrd
text: We love United Bank and the hometown personal experience we get with each branch. We are truly blessed to be able to have a bank where you can call and ask for someone by name. Having that personal banking relationship makes life so much easier to navigate.

She has a "mortgage" through them that doesn't even appear on her credit report.  I can go on and on about them, but you can figure it out for yourself. You are better off banking with a company who has the balls to back you and your finances!

text: The one woman on duty was courteous. But I'm pissed that this gas station doesnt allow for paying customers ( we filled up on gas ) to use their microwave for their own food. We bring our own food with us on roadtrips due to being whole food plant based vegans and knowing that gas stations dont cater to our food needs. Also not wanting to live on "snack foods" while on the road, because these are not filling and we find ourselves hungry again in an hour or so.  Circle K needs to ease up on on this restriction. It makes for some very pissed off paying customers when you've been on the road for hours on end and want a hot meal.

text: This Shell station is always a mystery. Sometimes, depending on who is working, they'll take manufacturer's coupons for cigarettes, other times they won't. The price of a pack of cigarettes seems to change between cashier to cashier. Overall, the store is a bit pricey. Definitely cheaper (priced, quality, or both) can be found right down the road. After sunset, you'll have to wade through a sea of folks to stand in front of a glass window in order to get service.

name: Shanay Mac
text: The prices are cheap but so is the customer service!!! They smoke inside the store, which may be ok with smokers but not with myself and many others, I'm sure! I walked in with my 3mth old baby and inhaled a cloud of smoke over near the ATM machine, I asked if they smoked cigarettes inside, one replied "No, weed" then they laughed. I told them I was going to another store with my money and baby, the other one said "he'll smoke when he's bigger" ....needless to say I got very distasteful with them both and left. I'LL NEVER GO BACK AGAIN. May have thousands of customers, but they definitely lost two!

I very much appreciate the help and guidance i recieved and would like to thank her and this branch for finalizing the matters at hand. She was knowledgable and professional and very caring. If there were more people like her, the world would indeed be a better place! I hope she receives the recognition she deserves.

text: This is the worst branch ever. If you can, I highly recommend you do your banking elsewhere. Their processes are the most antiquated I've seen anywhere. The tellers act as if they're entitled, rude and so snooty! You are all servants to the community that bank here which allows you to receive a paycheck. Be grateful. Humble yourselves and then act accordingly. However, I don't think any changes will be made as long as they have the same branch manager.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your feedback. I truly apologize for the customer service you experienced at this branch and would like to review what happened in detail. text: I came by the drive through to deposit a check. It was made out to my spouse and me. I was the only one who signed as I did not know we both needed to sign. I feel that the tellers could have been more courteous in explaining to me why they could not cash the check.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your experience at this location, Jennie. I'm disappointed to hear you were spoken to in this way and would like to address it as quickly as possible. Please tell me more about what happened in an email to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com, and be sure to mention your full name, Google username, phone number, and address (no account numbers). I look forward to hearing from you. -Jessica, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: David Missildine
text:
I first went to the ATM outside as I am handicapped and this is the easiest option for me. The atm was out of order, therefore I had to go inside to do my business. I walked up to the waiting spot as both tellers were occupied. The one teller had finished her business with the customer and was having a casual chat
I was ok with this as customer service is important.  After this customer left, I approached the window as the girl said to me 'give me a minute "
At this time she turned to the girl behind her and started a casual conversation with her. I felt ignored and disrespectful. I will never be back to this branch.

resp.text: I'm sorry to learn about your experience at this location, David. Could you email me with more details about your interaction with the team member you mentioned? Please address it to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com. Be sure to include your full name, phone number, address, and review as well (no account numbers). I'll make sure your visit is reviewed by the appropriate team. -Jessica, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: Phillip Malbrough
text:
The ATM is almost always broken or out of service, or just doesn't have any cash in it.

I had used Capitol One Bank for a really long time, but after traveling a bit, I noticed that Capitol One was a smaller regional thing, and Wells Fargo was more available and widely used, at least in the areas I had been traveling to. But since I've arrived in Decatur, there was only this location where you could go inside to  talk with representatives, and two other locations that were just ATM'S. One of those had been removed, so now there's really only one Wells Fargo ATM in all of Decatur... And it's not at this bank..

resp.text: Thanks for bringing this to our attention, Phillip. I apologize for the inconvenience and have forwarded your feedback about the ATM at this branch appropriately. Should you have additional concerns please email more details to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com and mention your review and Google username (no account numbers). -Janet, Wells Fargo HL Social

text: Opening an account at this location was a mistake, stay as far away as you can. I try to only leave positive reviews for places I enjoy, but after a terrible experience time after time, it needs to be mentioned that you will not enjoy your your experience here and you need to look elsewhere for your banking needs.

resp.text: I’m sorry you continue to experience difficulties at this location, and I want to be sure these concerns are addressed. name: Allie Elsberry
text:
Jack Norris is the best Banker in Wells Fargo. If i could give more then 5 stars I would. I had some major issues trying to open an account. Jack went above and beyond to help me get the accounts after i kept getting the runaround from Wells Fargo Corp.  5 trips to his branch (which is an hour drive 1 way. so normally this was 3-3 1/2 hour thing for me) and 4 of the times the "back office" saying I needed to do this first. so i would do it. then i would need to do something else the next time. on and on. Jack never gave up and fought on my behalf. After going to the bank today again for the 5th time and Jack calling their "back office to see why i still could not open an account the day ended at 5:15pm and we opened an account!
thank you Jack for everything!

resp.text: I'm very pleased to hear that Jack was able to assist you with opening an account, Allie. However, I’m sorry to hear about your overall experience with us at this location. To ensure I can forward your concerns appropriately, please mention your review and Google username in an email to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com (no account numbers). Thanks so much for your feedback. -Nick, Wells Fargo HL Social

text: Great gas station always have a personal taste and really great people they always treat ya like family

name: KOFFIN nails
text: Terrible place. Not clean smells like old dirty mop water, incompetent workers, on the phone half the time or turns wrong pump on, and the number 1 thing, asked years ago after the owner sold it if they were going to fix the parking lot and it hasn't changed so seeing as they don't have handicap parking and it's impossible for a wheelchair to even roll on it i have filed a claim with the ADA seeing as they have more than 4 parking spots they are required to have one. 2 stars? Cause they have back up generators and open 24 hours. But I stopped going since Feb 2020

name: Nikkinz
text: They have the best biscuits around the area. They do seem to run out of some foods (sometimes bacon but everyday eggs) and dont really prepare more even if I come in at 7 a.m for breakfast every single day. The girls have been very polite up until recently and not quite sure why that's changed but it's made me feel unwelcomed and I guess I'll have to start going back to Jack's. The older ladies are always nice and polite and though I could understand if it was sporadic visits during the week but it's literally everyday that I come for breakfast and lunch. They have great coffee the best I've found in Cullman. Again though the attitudes have made my visits undesirable and I'll be going there less now.  Another example has been when I get wings or chicken strips or even a hamburger they dont ask if I want condiments that generally go with the food but they will ask everyone around me if they want sauce or lettuce and tomato??? I am in Cullman for work purposes and when I found this place it was like a little hole from home and I fell in love but that has since deteriorated a bit and will be visiting less. :(

name: Judy Moctezuma
text: The biscuits are the best! However it seems they have a set amount they cook every morning and always run out early.My opinion is they should cook more as they already know they run out and have to turn away so many wanting breakfast. Also the lunch food items are cooked the fast way either in a microwave or a oven and would taste much better if ( for example) egg rolls , pizza sticks, tater wedges were deep fried not cooked in a microwave. Also maybe add more variety of lunch menu items. Just little things could use improvement but over all it  is a great store and the owner will order things to sell in the store if a customer ask and it is in his power to do so.I had ask for a certain kind of liquid creamer and it is now sold there.🎉

name: Karen Patterson
text: I love that they are open 24 hrs. and keep a huge variety of food, snacks and hardware items. The stores shelves are always stocked and perfectly arranged and the entire store is always neat and clean no matter what time of day or night I stop in. Most of the cashiers are always friendly and courteous.

name: Michael Glasscock
text: Always nice, friendly service and staff. Great breakfast as well as their other food. I highly recommend this place to anyone. It’s a great hometown store.

name: Elizabeth McGraw
text: Never use your food stamp card there they will over charge you and won't put it back on your card or fix the problem

name: Daquari Bishop
text: Has the BEST 🥓 biscuits in Cullman!!!!! Everyone is so friendly especially that little hottie Emily  SHE ROCKS 🎸💯

name: Anita Brannan
text: Shop here daily. Employees friendly. I get 1-2 cups of ice everyday because I absolutely am hooked on the crushed ice. My only complaint is the fluctuating price of ice. While I agree with charging for the cup used to hold the ice, I dont think charging for frozen water is  not really necessary, seriously. I and my family are there EVERY day and spend a lot of .money so I think ice would be a nice gesture especially when  I'm furnishing the cup. Mrs. Ann doesn't like my being in so often for ice apparently and charges me .more than any other cashier because "the price has gone up".....  For ice that  I put in my cup. The only assistance I received was the cashier taking my money. Of course all of this is petty and I don't mind paying for this service, because they have the ice I like and want so its warranted for me. Would just appreciate a little more courtesy and less fluctuating prices.

resp.text: While no public business is perfect, we do strive to be. Thank you for letting us know where we have come short so that we can work on that issue. Thank You for your business

name: Joshua Thomas
text: great place , anything you need , you can get it here

name: Bruce Bentley
text: We have SNOW SLEADS come and get yours  before they’re gone. Limited quantities. Enjoy the snow.

name: Chris Kelso
text: The atm did not dispense my money due to being tied into phone line. So if you are getting money out to spend at that store..you will get screwed. I am a very loyal customer who will no longer go to this store. Clerk was very rude and acted like she could care less. Did not want to call the mananager. Acted like it was a big hassle to call him. I spend on average 180.00 a week on gas and about $50 a week on breakfast and drinks. I will let everyone know what a rip off this store is. I can see why you can't keep no help and it is a different person every two weeks.

name: Brandy Dingler
text: Love stopping threw on my way home or to work

Do NOT go in there! You have been warned.

text: #1 YOU WERE OPEN!!!!! we passed several exits and everyone was closed...we kept trying right up until we ran out of gas! Tamia came off her break because the other girl was nowhere to be found. She got us in and out quick so we could get back to our puppies in a jiffy! Thank you Tamia

text: Clean bathroom, horrible place to poop. After being on the road for 8 hours, 10 minutes on the throne isn't too much to ask. Now I'm in a bad mood, and I'm not sure if I'll ever recover. Be weary, traveler.

name: Chuck
text:
PNC Bank I like the features they offer.  I really like when I use my credit card or ATM card I get a text in seconds. Also,  my credit card number got stolen and they only charged $0.02 in CA and then they tried to use it in GA at 2 Redbox location and Wal-Mart and they declined it. I was called by PNC in minutes to ask if the was me,  I told them No I am at my house in Alabama. The lady was really sweet got the card shut down and a replacement in the mail in days.
They call every 3 months and make sure that I am happy with the service. They ask if would like to come see if they have any new needs. The new credit card I like I atleast get 1% on everything up to 4% on things. I would recommend this bank to anyone.

name: Firalis 0714
text: Once again improperly trained staff cost me and my wife time and money when both of our cards declined on payday and we had to go to the atm that charges exorbitant amounts. Please fixed this issue. The manager that's been there for a while was there and has been there regularly training this employee. Why is it an issue for me to use my card when a new employee ( trained by this manager, because the late night new employees are excellent and)is behind the register?.?

resp.text: We definitely hear your concerns and appreciate your feedback. We've made sure to pass it along to the appropriate channels. -Trish

name: Comfort Services
text:
Worst bank I’ve ever dealt with. $25 to cash a check written on their account.
Processing at the end of the day consist of withdrawing all transactions starting with the largest first, then deposits.  This can result in many $45 overdraft fees when the money is actually there to cover the withdrawals.

resp.text: We apologize for the inconvenience and would like to learn more. Please send your phone number to askRegions@regions.com. Our team will call you. -Tyler

text: I had an appointment today confirmed twice by Regions, and when I got there, bank was closed. Also their ATM never works!! I've been with them for 5 years, what a mistake! Absolutely nor recommending this bank!

name: Ginny Greene
text: Horrible experience. They want your money, and they will get it any way possible. Beware I gave a 1 star only because you could not give zero star. They screwed with a lot of my money. Go anywhere but here protect your money   Run run fast as far away as you can from regions.  I didn’t run and now I’m paying

name: Rheeta Zell
text:
I am very happy with the professionalism  that I received from Ashley Jacks regarding my HELOC.
The whole process took maybe less than 30 days. Ashley Jacks was on top of the loan and I truly truly appreciate how much she cares and loves her profession and her job. I wholly recommend doing business with Ashley at the Gulf Shores branch

name: Jimmy Williams
text: The staff at this bank is ALWAYS friendly, patient and helpful. I absolutely enjoy my visit here each week. They are almost like family. ❤

name: Patrice Clements
text:
I’ve banked with Regions for well over a decade in MO and this branch is a joke! Unorganized, unhelpful and incompetent.
Went in to get a proof of funds for a home purchase, the woman said she would email it to me. Never received it. Called back and the woman on the phone assured me it was being emailed by closing yesterday.
Had to go back this morning and it still hadn’t been taken care of. I sat and waited until Rhonda could get a one sentence letter completed.
If I need anything else, I’ll call my MO branch and have them take care of it. Very disappointing level of service from beginning to end.

name: Otabek Kamilov
text: Horrible drive thru service

name: John Littbeach
text: Great service.  Had a crazy charge on my card and the bank manager called me personally and took care of it.  You can’t get that kind of service with an online operator half way around the world. Fees are competitive but the local branch folks make it.

name: Sandra P.
text: I had to deal with Regions Customer Service the other day and in the process dealt with 2 of their Customer Service Representatives.  I must say that both gentlemen were extremely helpful, courteous and everything I would look for in a representative from any company.  Dealing with them was a pure pleasure.  I was extremely impressed!!!  Other companies need to take lessons from Regions Customer Service.  Thanks Guys!!

name: Jake Dunaway
text: Terrible. Went through today and had horrible service. Tiffany was rude and short.

name: Ron Langley
text: I have never witnessed so many incompetent people under one roof,  the Walmart of banks would be a compliment. One star is an injustice, they dont deserve it.

name: Patrick Aldrich
text: I've been banking with regions Bank through my business and personal accounts for 15 years.  Today may have been the last straw, I was driving up to the drive-thru and was about three car lengths away when they turn the sign over to closed and when I pulled up a second later they just ignored me. This was on a Friday afternoon at 5 last business day of the month. Why are banks closing at 5 on a Friday now? Don't even get me started on Saturdays. I don't know how many times I've done a transaction through the drive-thru, and not even heard a hello goodbye or thank you or my name. I think I'll be going to a bank that's a little more hometown.

name: Hazley Roberts
text: Very rude staff. Just because you have a bad day doesn’t mean u have to take it out on ur customers

name: Marcus Boleng
text: This branch is not open at all on Saturday. It also has a habit of closing the drive through 10 minutes early. It can be very annoying if you leave work at 4:30 and really need to deposit a check that day. Hey not all banks care about their customers.

That is the kind of service that makes it worth the drive from Florence,Al to Athens,Al just to use PNC and the customer service they provide.

When us normal people with out a major credit get a driver license it takes two forms of i d to get it. Treat is with respect don't need a fake hi when come in the door show me respect by treating normal people right I wouldn't bank here if they gave me 100k to start with

One pack of candy and a small 8pk of Tums was almost $6.00.

text: Without a doubt they must think their gas is gold plated.... highest price you will find anywhere. Also everything in the store is high too. Super convenient for me but I won't stop here even to use the bathroom. I'm sure Buc-ee's will put them in their place or shut them down.

Thank God I carry hand sanitizer and sanitizer wipes. Completely unacceptable. If my daughter could have held it we would have went elsewhere.

text: I called 3 times, & each time they hung up in my face. The last time I called, I asked to speak with a manager. text: Don't buy the food. I bought a 3-rib plate for $8.99 and she gave me 2 good ones and a tiny one. Normally if they have small ones they'll give u 2 small ones. Not today. For $9 u should get decent size pieces. They will dog through the pan instead of giving u the big ones on top. The chicken is old and hard. They know the biscuits r old cuz they ask u if I want it! Sometimes I ask if the biscuits r old or hard and they say, "Yeah, u don't want it." Other times, many times, they give me a hard biscuit. It's ridiculous.

name: Mathu McErlean
text:
DO NOT SHOP HERE! I walked in with a mask to protect myself and others in the store, the store attendant was rude and demanded I take off my
mask or I wouldn’t be provided service. I thought she was joking until another customer walked in with a mask and she demanded him to remove his mask. I said to the attendant, I refuse to remove my mask, you can believe what you want; but I need to ensure you are not infected with the virus and the only way to do that, is to wear a mask.
She began to yell stating she didn’t believe the covid hype.
Me- that’s your choice, but you have no business to tell me or anyone else not to wear one, if we chose to protect ourselves. If you want covid that’s your business and choice but I will not remove my mask. She started to yell even louder how I need to remove my mask and how she’ll call the cops for me wearing one. I’ll tell them you tried to rob me, then you’ll take your mask off. I replied to call them. I laughed of course. She continued to yell, degrading me. I told her  her behavior is not needed,  I will take my Business elsewhere! You mad over a mask for what.. 😂🤣😂
No wonder why Alabama covid cases are on the rise, too many people without common sense.

Happened- July 5, 2020 @8:00AM!

name: Val Carter
text: Some parking for big rigs that's paved.. friendly people..good hot food..clean public bathrooms

name: Chris Thompson
text: Diesel pump takes nearly 1 minute per gallon.  If you're in a hurry to get diesel DO NOT STOP HERE.

name: J.Curtis Turner
text: The workers are friendly and very nice.  The store is clean and after all, it is a gas station. When ever possible I alway  buy my gas there.

name: Jeff Wahl

name: Michelle Janko
text: This place is a joke. They ran out of toilet paper! The girl behind the counter watches me run my 4 year old daughter in to use the bathroom and says nothing about it.  I came back out to get some more and she points at a roll of paper towels and says, you'll have to use that." Seriously?!?

text: Crappy all around. I'm sure some of the people who work there are nice but the building is in horrible shape and the dang ATM charges $4 for a simple transaction?

text: Awful! Do not bank with them! They never answer the phone. I called hundreds of times over the weekend and Monday. They put you on endless hold. They NEVER ANSWERED.

text: It took me a long time to get my debit card I've been without money for 4 days and I still ain't got my debit card with my cash on it

text: Brady and crew are reminiscent of an older bank devoted to customer service while at the same time possessing all of the latest technologies. I would bank here because of the team alone. Great service! Feels like being a part of the family.

resp.text:
We’re thrilled we could meet your expectations. We think Lindsay is pretty great as well :) Thanks for leaving the positive review, we hope to see you again soon.
Regards, Alabama Credit Union

text: Terrible experience working with them... Having multiple problems. They have no desire to work problems out... They just take my money and leave me to fend for myself. I recommend finding a better suited company. This one should be shut down.

text: This Shell Station chose to PRICE GOUGE the community customers.  Before Hurricane Sally when the community was preparing they raised their fuel prices and after Hurricane Sally they were charging outrageous prices for fuel, drinks and snacks. When devistation hits a community you don't take advantage of them. Get out of our community we don't want you here. Shell company needs to pull their name and fuel from all this owners locations.

text: My wife and I have been long time customers here at Pawn Express. Every Interaction I have with any of the employees here is a treat. They are all very customer service oriented, very knowledgeable about everything they buy and sale, and are always willing and ready to help people. Enough good things cant be said about this establishment.

name: Gale Renteria
text: Went in needing help with a big purchase and got just that from manager, Mo Odom. He was extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and overall a joy to work with. I highly recommend their store. They have a wide variety so they probably have what you are looking for. If you go in, ask for Mo. He will get you taken care of. Also, Brandi with an “I” was just as friendly and helpful. You can’t go wrong with Pawn Express!

name: Kaysolovely
text: I rated them one star because I went in trying to sale a game system that I bought from them just a couple weeks prior & he asked me how much I wanted from it. Usually I tell them what are they willing to give me, but he still was asking what I wanted for it. I told him & he couldn’t work with that. I had a Xbox One & he said they’re about 15 yrs old so tell me why they were selling them for nearly $200 but he can’t even give me $100 to sale it back.

resp.text: Sorry for the unpleasant experience. Not sure what happened, but if you will call or come by and speak to Brandi, we will try to figure it out.

name: Ghostlyyy
text:
Best pawn shop in Troy, not for their merchandise (though they have a great selection) or for any of their other many services, but for the people.

Brandy is amazing and always wants to help however she can, she works he’s and treats others with the utmost respect

Mo is large in both heart and body, he’s one of the funniest people I’ve ever met and keeps me
Laughing the entire time I’m there. (And he’s not bad on the eyes either)

Other people work there too

Sometimes I come just to talk to the staff, love those guys.

name: Michael Watts
text: This is not your ordinary pawn shop, you are not met at the door with the smell of despair and shattered hopes. No you are met with a sincere welcome by the friendliest and most helpful group of pleasant misfits.  The inventory is well organized and each employee will answer any question and help you locate that perfect item. And did I mention guns yep got them too

name: Jeffery Smitherson
text: Pawn express is like a second family, they are friendly and always there to help. Moe has an amazing personality and will keep you laughing the entire time you’re there, and brandy is super kind and caring. They have a find selection of merchandise and cut you good deals. Been a regular for 4 years and will probably always go here. Best business in Troy.

name: Allyson Sneed
text: Mo and Brandi are the best two people there! They will help you out quickly and they are always friendly. When you go to Pawn Express and they are busy they are definitely worth the wait. ❤️

name: Michael Benton
text: The best pawn shop since the beginning of all time. Mo touched me inspirationally as well as inappropriately. I give them stuff and they give me money in return. It's a great place to get stuff your want cheaper than it regularly cost...win-win

name: Kenneth Duncan
text: Very good place to do business! Always some kind of a great deal. Brandi Duncan is the best pawn broker in the world!

name: Joshua Odom
text: I’m a repeat customer. You might say I’m like family there. When buying merchandise, I take into account my 57 kids, therefore I usually look for discounts. This is where you find discounts. I may look like a potato, but one day I’ll turn into fries, and you’ll want me then... So, I got a little off track. Anyhoo, if you need stuff and like saving $, try these folks first. Mo is slightly better than the field.

name: Mary Kilcrease
text: Mo. Mo. He has found any strange collectible I have asked for,  zero questions. Silver coin with a mythical bird on it. Found. Signed copy of my 6th grade science book. Found. Mo is all ways discrete, and professional. Definitely recommend.

text: Best pawn shop this side of the Mississippi. If you need something to see Mo!

text: I have bought several things from here!! Mostly jewlery, everyone was helpful but I gotta say Brandi is my favorite!! Every time I go I always ask for her!!

name: Cherie Duncan
text: Great place to go to everyone there is friendly and they make sure to help you with what you need or what you are looking for.

name: Shan Sharp
text: Pawn Express is the only pawn shop I’ll visit. Any time I’m looking for something I call Brandi. She is the BEST pawn broker around.

name: Rashawn Little
text:
"I drove to Montgomery and got 350 for a saxophone that Pawn Express Of Troy refused to buy

purchased  an abandoned  storage  unit at an auction in Jacksonville fl and stumbled  upon a used saxophone  i reached out to pawn express troy and one of the associates told me one the phone to bring it in and they'll  take a look I drove from Brantley al to troy al and one the male associates offered  80 dollars for it but couldn't  pawn because I grabbed  my expired  ID by mistake so about 2 weeks later I drove back and and talked with now a female  associates who I told I was offered  80 dollars  for the saxophone  and she also offered  80 dollars as well but after looking the saxophone brand up online USED OR NOT its worth a little over 500 dollars... me having no intrest for it, all I ask was "can we do 100" because its not In the best condition missed a few tiles that sit on the key pads and minor gold fading as all used instruments do "especially woodwind instruments" she called a lady (brandi) over for a second opinion  and the lady very nasty told me "we not interested in buying because it would be hard for us to sale". My problem is 2 associates gave me an offer for 80 and just because  I ask for 20 more dollars on a sax worth 500, now all of a sudden  "were not interested in buying" very rude and very unprofessional. You definitely  cant try to low blow everyone i guess the fact that im a young "BLACK "man she figured i just wanted fast cash NOT AT ALL. if I would have sold  the sax for 80 like I originally  intended  on doing they would have restored  it for lil to nothing  and had it out on the show room floor for 500 dollars bottom line they they'll offer Jesus a dollars  for each nail just to sale it to the railroad track for 100 dollars each .

resp.text: Sorry you had a bad experience but I’m glad you finally got what you were looking for. Hope you have a Happy New Year.

text:
These guys have so much personality, I always enjoy my experience at Pawn Express!!

Also sorry Mo...Team Brandi

resp.text: It’s wonderful to see that you had such a positive experience with Cynthia! Thank you for taking the time to share these kind words. -Janet, Wells Fargo HL Social

text: On my way to start closing my accounts.  On Friday 11/25 Wells Fargo was hit with another fine of $1 billion for auto loan & mortgage "bad acts".  That's over $4 billion since 2016.  I've been with them for over 40 years.  Don't use this bank!

resp.text: I'm sorry to see your review, Tana. If you’d like to discuss any concerns in further detail, please send an email to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com and mention your review and Google username (no account numbers). Thanks. -Nick, Wells Fargo HL Social

text: I really Like this bank but plz open the lobby back up Redstone and im sure other banks have its a really big inconvenience for most people

resp.text: Hi, Will. I appreciate you taking the time to share this with us. As an essential business, we strive to remain open where we can to serve you. We have changed operating hours and temporarily closed a number of locations for the safety of our customers and employees and continue to monitor how we are responding to the COVID-19 situation as it evolves. In the meantime, please visit https://www.wellsfargo.com/locator/ for updated branch availability and hours. We appreciate your feedback and understanding. -Janet, Wells Fargo HL Social

I understand it's not the stamps fault but policies like this keep me with a smaller hometown bank.

We will be moving all accounts away from Wells Fargo.

resp.text: I'm truly sorry to hear this, Shawn. text: Went to purchase some brake fluid anda few more items. When I got ready to pay for the items the sticker on the brake fluid said 3.99 but cashier rung it up for 4.99. Over the course of the past 3 months, the ATM has been out of service. This has been occuring more frequently than desired. The nearest regions ATM is on Atlanta highway. They should block the driveway next time this occurs. It is the most inconvenient something to happen when arriving at the bank.

text:
Paresh Mistry, (Pronounced "Parish Mystery") & Hemant, (Pronounced "Hammond") & Hemant's Wife Puru, (Pronouced "Peru"), are so Cordial that it is Always a Pleasure going inside to Chat with them... Even if I Am just going to Pay at the Pump Outside, I Go Inside Just to Talk With them.  This is a Value Added Stop~!

And talk about Upscale, the Restrooms with Lights that come on Automatically when you walk in and Marble Tiled Walls Rival the Best Hotels in the World~!  You must stop here, if for nothing else just to see the bathrooms. The Restrooms Certainly Smell Fresh And Just like the Kind Folks at the Front that are Always Smiling, this is a very Pleasant Stop and will add Joy to your Step and a Sparkle in your Eye, (plus, They are the only Convenient Store for miles around that sale Zagnut Candy Bars).

Even if I am 30-40 miles away and Low on Gas, but I can make it back to Papa John's that's what I do ~ because I so Enjoy the Friendly Atmosphere that doesn't Vex me.  With the LED Track Lighting, the Store is Always Bright and Cheery.

And they also sell the Hard to Find Non-Ethanol Gasoline.  From my Experience, You can be sure that you'll Always get Exceptionally Great Gasoline here that won't make your Vehicle Gurgle, and that there won't be any water in their Tank.  And all their Pumps are brand-new with Video Displays on them.

Ask them about the Warren Fire Starter Fluid, (No Relationship), and they'll know I sent you~!
