name: Whitney Mixon
text:
Update:
After that unfortunate experience I started going to the Gulf Shores location. They're pretty great out there. Anyway, a couple months ago I attempted the Foley PNC (only because it's a lot closer than GS) and what a change! Although, there's usually only one or two employee(s) working the window and/or counter, but they're super friendly and always acknowledge me when they're busy. Makes me want to continue going to this branch.

Original post:
Pulled up to the drive through today about 1:45 pm and I was the only one there. I saw two girls working behind the computers at the window. I assumed they were busy dealing with other customers. Cool, I'll wait. What's not cool? Neither of them even acknowledged I was there. I work in customer service and if I'm busy I'll at least say "I'll be with you in a moment." Most people are okay with that, I'm okay with that. Alas, I didn't get that from them. I sat there probably close to five minutes. Another car had pulled into the slot to my right about four minutes after me and sent in the container. She wasn't waiting very long before the lady with the name plate where the first letter was a J grabbed her container, then finally made eye contact with me and dispensed the drawer for me to put my money into for my car payment. Imagine my frustration when she acknowledged this woman that pulled up about four minutes after me. I let J proceed with the other customer, but when she went to put in my payment I just had to know why. I mean, you'd be curious too, right? Her reason was it isn't personal, but she didn't see me sitting behind the gigantic window that's directly in front of her face. Yes, she was behind a computer, but several times she moved from behind it to place some receipts into the bin underneath where the containers come in. You can't be that oblivious when there's a window there. Unless.. dare I say it? You choose to be. It was quite amusing for her to think I would believe that horrible excuse. If your employees are that unaware of your customers, as J stated, then maybe they should be retrained a little better. To have employees that have such poor customer service skills looks bad on the company as a whole.

name: Stephen Wisener
text: Be Careful if you are a member here. Somehow criminals have gained access AND the ability to call you from one of Redstone Federal credit Union legitimate phone numbers.....a actual business number used by Redstone Federal credit Union! They will attempt to call you and tell you that they are with the fraud department and that they want to verify some purchases made from your account because there were some "red flag" transactions. They will then say did you make a 500 dollar purchase at a Target in "so and so" California......you will say NO then that's when they will proceed to get the ACTUAL information they need to get your money! Be safe, Be aware, and Give NO information unless you are "in person" at the actual Bank. Good luck, and God Bless.

name: Joseph Harris
text: I'm not sure if the underwriter that just called me is extremely racist or just don't know what's she's doing. I went to the rural king in Chester Pa and saw an equipment that i wanted to purchase for my business. Spoke to a rep there and he told me that I can apply for their business credit card though redstone federal credit union. So i applied on Sunday 05/18/20. On Monday a Melissa Wilson called me back and said the credit card was approved but she need to open a membership for me first to finalize everything. She took my basic information and said I'll received a docu sign by the end of the day. I got an email from Melissa on Tuesday night saying that the underwriter needed 2 year of business tax returns, a utility bill, a mortgage statement and a selfie of myself with me holding my ID. I thought the last request was a little strange but I submitted everything anyway. Got a call from an underwriter on Wednesday and this is where I think she just dont have a clue about what she's doing or is extremely racist. She asked me how far was rural king store was from me? I told her about an hour plus. She then ask why I close two credit cards in 2019. Told her I had two credit cards from the same company so I requested that they combine the credits from both cards on to one and close one, which they did. And that i didn't close the barclay card. I was an authorized user on the barclay card and the primary user close the card that's why why it appear on my credit as close. But I went ahead and open up my personal barclay card in December of 2019. She then ended by saying well I'm not satisfied with the two cards that were closed, and there's a fraud alert on your credit and this seems like fraud. I told her yes I place a fraud alert on my credit so that no one can open up fraudulent account in my name. A fraud alert will tell a company to give me a call and verify its me before opening up a new account. People do that all the time. She said well this seems like fraud. I told her you have my ID, Mortgage statement, utility bill, my social security number, phone number that you're talking to me on matches the phone number with the credit bureau that's on my fraud alert, my 2 years of business tax returns with my business name and my home address. I have a 732 fico score and a 80/100 dunn and Bradstreet score. I have all the credentials needed for approval. Credit, income, etc. But all they saw was a driver's license of a beard black guy, that have a fraud alert place on his credit and two close credit cards that one of them he requested to be closed and the other was close by the primary card holder. And the scary part about this entire situation is the young lady that told me all this is an "underwriter". An underwriter who's racist or an underwriter that don't know that it's legal to call the credit bureau and request that they place a fraud alert on your credit and give them a number to place on your credit to have potential credit call you and verify its you before opening an account. Also an underwriter that don't know that if you become an authorized user on one of your family members card that entire card history gets transferred to your credit history. And if the person closes that card it will also close on you credit profile. So much for " Equal Opportunity Lender".

resp.text: Let me assure you that RFCU has a strict policy of non-discrimination not only in the credit union’s lending practices, but in all aspects of conduct throughout RFCU. When opening accounts and taking applications for credit, RFCU must complete certain due diligence requirements in order to validate the identity of the applicant, as required by federal law. Due diligence is completed for every applicant in order to both comply with federal law and safeguard our members from potential fraud.

Mind you she didn't say I had to get a certain size, I just grabbed a cup not paying attention to the exact size.I got a medium instead of a small. So that's like what a 4 once difference? We're going to make a fuss over that? Really???I should have just set it down but I went ahead and paid for it anyways. To me that's not how you should treat a customer.  But whatever I wont be back. I will take my business elsewhere.

name: Bob Lawry
text: Sleezy business practice.   Watch the pump - they advertise a cheaper price on the sign than what is at the pump.  Sign said $2.39, started pumping and the pump  read $2.43.   At the end of the day $.56 does not break the bank but multiply that times the volume through the station - they are making a ton off false advertising on their street sign.   Brought it to their attention they would not refund $.56 on principle even with my receipt.   Shady practice - check the pump before you pump.

name: Luz Bohorquez
text: I made the worst mistake of my life by going inside the Chevron Store  by Lorna Road in hoover. Without provocation., a man who identified himself as manager of the store started verbally attacking me with derogatory comments the minute he noticed that i spoke with an accent. He then proceeded to tell me how much he hated people like me because he had a wife of the same nationsl origin. He kept on insulting me with racist remarks as i left the store, scared and shocked  it is a shame that highly respected brands like chevron could allow a racist of this caliber to denigrate unsuspecting customers with impunity. My only crime was to believe that i was entering a respected establishment because it held the trustworthy brand of chevron.

I don't consider that a safe option as I've been seeing identity theft issues everywhere and don't know if these reps are honest people or not. What they need is a real IT Dept to help with the online issues.

I went inside to show them the receipts and asked for a manager, they said there wasn't one available and call my card company. They knew something was wrong with their atm & they had no regard for whatever happened. I will never go here again and I wouldn't advise anyone to use their atm. From the looks of things, they won't be in business long.

name: S H
text: Literally the worst place to get a loan through. I’ve paid my truck payment every month for over two years now. If you are even one day late you start getting emailed and phone called. As many here have pointed out... making the customer happy is not their strength apparently.

resp.text: Thank you for your honest feedback. We want to sincerely apologize for your disappointing experience. Customer service is our top priority and the last thing we want is to let our members down. We are always working to improve and we rely on valuable feedback like this to make us even better. Thank you!

name: Amy Allen
text: Rude, Rude, and unhelpful. My Daddy passed and my mother was the account beneficiary. I called the make sure he still had an account here. The lady who answered ask for a social (last digit was wring turns out). She refused to look him up by name or my mother’s name. I called back, spoke to another lady who was understanding because he Dad had passed too. She found the error and my Daddy’s account. When I went to withdraw the money from the Albertville location, both the tellers were fussing over should we get the money because he was deceased. My mom was with me. They were told twice, yes, she can close the account but they had an attitude about us closing it. Worse experience and worse timing on their part. I have told EVERYONE THAT I HAVE came in contact with regarding this situation. So pitiful!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience, Amy. We are truly sorry to hear about the loss of your father, our deepest condolences to you and your family. We would like to sincerely apologize that you were treated with anything other than kindness and empathy when you were closing your father's account. This is not what we want our members to experience and we will make sure to address this issue with our team. Thank you again for your feedback and we wish you all the best.

name: Michaelea Pass
text:
I left my purse at home and needed to get cash since I was over 30 minutes away and didn't have time to drive back to get it. I went to this bank and luckily I had my check book in my car but the lady in the drive thru didn't seem to really care and said you have to have a photo I.D no matter what.

I shamefully did this before a few years ago and they just asked me my personal Information and made me sign a paper so that way I could get cash taken out. I told her I would go to the other regions where someone would be nice enough to help me. I went to the regions on hill crest and she was the exact opposite of the lady I talked to at this bank. I was able to get money out after telling her all of my personal info.

I understand it's to be safe but when someone knows all of their information by heart and can even pull up their account on their phone and tell them how much is in their account, I feel like there needs to be exceptions. Bad customer service.

resp.text: Our team would like to learn more about any concerns you may be having to have them formally documented. If we can call you, please send us an email with your phone number to askRegions@regions.com. One of our team members will call you.

name: Will Payne
text:
I have only been banking with Bank Independent for a short period of time. So far, they've been wonderful. Great mobile app, remote deposit from my office, friendly staff and sales personnel.

Deposits are available next business day.  My vendors and employees do not get charged to cash a check drawn on BI Bank.

Sales officers have come to my office twice to help get us set up with merchant services, line of credit, and remote deposit.

Great rates, friendly service, and a personalized touch.  It's nice to be able to speak face to face with the people that operate the bank.

Highly recommend these guys.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind review, Will! We are proud to have the opportunity to serve the financial needs of your business.

Secondly, and most importantly, I am so sorry that you had a bad experience in our office, and we would very much like to speak with you about it. Would you mind emailing us at social@bibank.com and providing a number where we could reach you? Thank you so much.

text:

I call this store to see if they had "Kelly Meats" ( I am from out of town), I was told that they did however, when I got there I couldn't find it. I spoke to the store manager Alonzo, and he found it for me.  Thank you for your professionalism and attention to detail.

text: We understand that things have changed since the covid-19 and I have been giving them most of my business. When I was here the other day the manager told me they moved back their closing time to 10pm. I was surprised. Online it says they close at 10pm & I pulled up at 8:50 PM just now and the rude rent-a-cop Security guy said, “They are closed” and so the now close 10 minutes before 9pm and they have a rude guy who wants to make sure you don’t come back? I am going to guess that PW many stores may lose customers & have to close too. Is it too much to ask to understand that the customer keeps you in business!

Do not work there until you ask what the sexual harassment policy is and who all to contact. Do they support calling police and will they allow police to review the recorded video. Also, is ask if there snitching retaliation.

Also ask how often they do anything about anyone selling drugs on the property on camera, and wether you can have relationships with other employees and related staff.

And check how clean the coffee area is by looking behind the coffee machine. You might change your mind about what you are drinking.

text: Latonya at the John Hawkins Wellsfargo is always so friendly and upbeat! I love her! She makes my day! Can’t beat an awesome attitude like hers. She’s a breath of fresh air! Keep up the great work!!

resp.text: I truly appreciate you taking the time to share these kind words with us, Christi. It’s wonderful to see that you’ve had such a positive experience with Latonya. Have a great rest of your day! -Shannon, Wells Fargo HL Social

text: I’ve dealt with three WF locations in the last 30 days. I’ve worked their system, made appointments. Trying to give WF more of my money. I’m taking my money elsewhere. No communication. No customer service. All they’ve done is cause aggravation. Done with you.

resp.text: I'm truly sorry to see this. Could you tell me more about what happened in an email? Please address it to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com, and be sure to mention your review and Google username (no account numbers). I'll make sure your experience is reviewed by the appropriate team. -Janet, Wells Fargo HL Social

Please address it to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com, and be sure to mention your Google username and review (no account numbers). Thank you for your feedback. -Shannon, Wells Fargo HL Social

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share this feedback. We appreciate you choosing Wells Fargo. -Shaun, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: Joseph Hope
text: This branch is very good. It has a new manager Joanna and she is great to work with. I would recommend going to this branch to anyone!

name: Kenneth Fountain
text:
They all have bent over backwards to help the average customer such as myself; to include, staying late on a Friday night to make sure I had what I wanted with my accounts.  They by far are the best bank I have ever dealt with in the 30+ years of having accounts and I trust that you will have the same experience.

So...  Not sure what the other person's (Chevi's) experience was but I can tell you that I have not had or seen that whatsoever!  They are a great group in that branch.

name: Kaila Morales
text: They treat you different if your not a business ess owner. I'm taking my business somewhere else.

resp.text: What happened to make you feel this way, Kaila? Please share some more details about your experience in an email to HLSocial@wellsfargo.com (no account numbers). Be sure to mention this review in your email. -Liz, Wells Fargo HL Social

text: This branch has the best customer service in the AREA! Been living in Bham for over 20 years and all I can say is this branch manager goes way above and beyond what any other WF Branch manager does for the customer. It sucks when I have to drive to other WF branches now :(

name: Julie Turpin
text: This branch is friendly except for banker marketta Williams she was so rude and unprofessional I filed a complaint and will not be back at that branch because of her. Teach bankers about customer service and not to yell or be rude to customers. I had to ask to speak to the manager 3 times because she was too busy being rude to me to connect me with the manager.

text: The worst bank ever. The red headed lady manager is extremely rude!

text: It's a nice place to get certain things. Good folks work there, and they're pretty friendly. Store layout is still a bit unclear, but improving. Still a fair amount of construction work. They cash checks, although I don't know the fees.

text: suzyQ . Liquor never picks up there phone r never sit up website r anything to tell time they open n close

name: Don Petry
text:
Though the pump is equipped with contactless payment, it is not actually enabled. When I spoke to the staff about this they indicated the owners do not plan to enable it. When I asked to leave feedback via a note or voicemail to the owner they indicated that was not possible.

My suggestion to cover the contactless reader with some tape or a sign was also dismissed.

Going forward, we will be driving past this gas station to another better run alternative.

text: Amazing customer service! Love being greeted every time I am there!

text: This is my favorite gas station to go to by far! Patrick is awesome and always gets us whatever we need! Great place deserves a great review.

name: Beau //
text:
This isn't my favorite Gas Station - but it's the closest to me OPEN 24/7 and they seem to always have fuel avail when the Shell Station on Acton Rd runs out from time to time. The store seems old and the inside is so crowded (w/ old cell chargers and jelly rolls hanging off shelves) u nearly have to walk sideways to walk thru parts of it.

The worst aspect is the front entrance/ drive-in to the pumps (the Cahaba Rd access) - its up a redic. hill with such an incline - driving down it over 3 mi/hr at the wrong angle will scrape ur engine and nearly take ur bumper off...

That being said - gas seems to work.

Get it together!!

Professional all the way, but they treat you as a human.
Do your banking here. A++

text: The lady with the glasses will roll her eyes and get mad if you ask for a bag for the two 2 liters of soda you purchased!! Unless you are a man don't expect any kindness , in fact one day i walked out of the store without all of the stuff i bought, the cashier said nothing!!! A couple days later when I finally made it back to the store i had the same cashier thats ALWAYS  rude , i pay for my items , expecting her to say hey was that you that had left stuff here?? Nothing!! So as I'm starting to walk out i turn and say , wait did i leave my bag here the other day? She says yup... thats all then stares blankly and finishes her conversation with the other cashier...  I said well I bought it do you think i can have my stuff i paid for? She sighs then just grabs the items and gives them to me while rolling her eyes.......  Excellent customer service 👎👎👎👎 notice how 78% of reviews are from men 👌👌👌

text: I can't believe I'm actually going to say this. I walked into this store then stood at the counter and ask for help in locating Coco Lopez liqueur. The cashier was leaning back in his chair watching his laptop wearing his headphones. He ignored me. I repeated my question to him about the location of the Coco Lopez liqueur. He pointed in the direction far away from him and said "yes you can go look for it."   I realized that I did not know what I was looking for. I need help! He let out a gasp and slipped his bare feet into some very casual flip flops and slid out to the store with me. I must have said the name five or six times and finally he points to the bottom of the Shelf instructing me to pick up the bottle myself.  I informed him that I was not looking for Pepe Lopez tequila. I'm looking for Coco Lopez liquor.  I happened to see the other reviews below mine and they were all one star as well. And I think one star is three-quarters of a star too much.

resp.text: I apologize for any inconvenience. We have changed operating hours and temporarily closed a number of locations for the safety of our customers and employees. Please visit https://www.wellsfargo.com/locator/ for up-to-date branch availability and hours. If you’d like to discuss your concerns further, please feel free to email us at HLSocial@wellsfargo.com (no account numbers). -AJ, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: Sydney Coleman
text: This is the absolute worst bank to do business with. I had to order a new debit card and after 2 weeks of waiting on one I was told I would have to wait another 7 days for my new one. I asked if there was any way they could expedite the card due to me having certain bills drafting out and was told no. So now here I am having to wait a whole week for a debit card once again. They had very poor customer service and I will be changing banks tomorrow.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your feedback, Sydney. I truly apologize for any inconvenience this has caused you. text: We were going to eat lunch at Subway and get some drinks after spending the day at the beach, but upon entering the store I was informed that the bathrooms were outside. I walked around the store expecting an outside entrance only to find THE BATHROOMS WERE PORTAPOTTIES AND THEY WERE DISGUSTING. We bought nothing and left and won’t be going back. It’s one thing to say restrooms are for customers only, it’s another to tell people to use filthy toilets outside in the summer heat. I would actually go with 0 stars were it an option. This is painful for me as I have a deep love for Circle Ks.

Just another shortcoming of customer service!!!

They refuse to cash any checks that are not written on their bank. My bank that I have to use is over an hour away.
The loan department has wonderful employees they are all very very nice.

name: Sue Wright
text: We moved during the pandemic and when we opened our accounts at Bryant Bank there was no opportunity to go into the bank and meet the people.  My husband handled most of it by phone and then we went to the drive through to finalize everything.  Laura, at the Trussville branch, could not have been nicer or more helpful.  By the time we drove away, we did not miss the “going in the bank” experience.

resp.text: We’re so glad to hear that you had such a great experience. Bryant Bankers work hard to put care into action for our customers and to provide unbeatable service!

name: Rod Hansen
text: Melissa at Bryant Bank helped me get a pre-approval letter for a loan. She was very professional, quick and knowledgeable. They were honest and upfront about interest rates, terms and monthly payment quotes. I was very impressed with their customer service.

resp.text: Hi Rod! Thank you so much for sharing your Bryant Bank experience with us.  We are grateful for our bankers and their commitment to serving their customers.  Welcome to the Bryant Bank family!

name: Diane Cole
text:
Best Bank around!  Trussville employees are professional but you feel more like friends. I've used other banks in the past but have been with Bryant from beginning & have NEVER been disappointed. Thanks to all my friends there!
😇

name: Jay Hall
text: My wife and I came from a "big" bank - in fact one we had been with for over 40 years - one she had actually worked for - for nearly 20 years. But after leaving their employ, the bank sold out to a larger bank- twice -  and we felt like a "number". We were recommended to talk to Bryant and when we did it was like meeting family! Natalie Norton and her excellent group of ladies just make us feel SO welcome EVERY time we go. They know us by name and go out of their way to greet us with smiles and serve us so splendidly. We wouldn't dream of going elsewhere for banking services. We are spoiled !!!!

resp.text: We are so glad that you love Bryant Bank and have experienced our unbeatable customer service.  Natalie and the team in Trussville are wonderful.  If we can ever do anything for you and your wife, please let us know!

name: drew cheek
text: I recently financed some property i wanted to buy and David Couture with America’s first was a pleasure to work with! He was a fantastic loan originator and made the whole land process easy to understand and stress free. I have bought and sold property before using other people in the past and it was never pleasant like this time was. Would highly recommend to others.

text: Had to wait a few minutes while the account representatives were waiting on others, but it was a reasonable wait time.  My son was getting his first account and they were super patient and friendly. I enjoyed it. Recommend this location!

name: Cameron Capps
text: I'm very satisfied with the service,think I'm going to start banking with them,atm works when it wants to

name: Kennelia
text:
I guess first impressions aren't important to this particular branch. Initially, the banker I sat with didn't bother to make conversation with me for a good 10 mins straight after being seated. I don't know her name because she didn't care to introduce herself.

Since she seemed annoyed about me simply asking her about them directly, I asked for a brochure about some products and services this CU offers. I had my hand out for it but she threw it on the table instead.

She was rude and very condescending for the first half of the appointment. It wasn't until I made her aware of my employment background in banking that she started to humanize her interaction with me.

There's another lady (she answers the phones) who walked right in the middle of the appointment and started talking to the banker... while I was in MID sentence! She didn't say "excuse me" or anything and the banker just sat there and let it happen.

I realize that the integrity (or lack there of) of these particular employees aren't necessarily reflective of how the company as whole will treat me.
But how can I wholeheartedly trust that this institution will thoroughly assess my banking needs, when they employ people who can't even execute concepts as simple as customer service?

name: janice brown
text: Made a trip for nothing . People that work there don't know what they are taking about should be better informed.  Won't be back

text: Worst bank ever!!! My husband went into the bank to do a transfer to an auto loan we have with them and little did we know the bank MANAGER never did it. This same bank is also responsible for putting my mothers account into the negative because they put her money in her savings account instead of her checking account( which she told & wrote on the deposite slip that it was to go into her checking). Plus the manager was SUPER RUDE!!

text: Long holds on every single check and hidden fees galore. Also, the employees are short with you, condescending and make no attempt to hide their attitude that you are just a number and that it is a privilige to you that they allow you to store your money in their bank. Google forced me to give at least 1 star in order to write this review but they don't even deserve that!

further to help remedy the situation. Please email our Member Support staff at Listeners@AlabamaCU.com and provide your contact information so we can work to rectify the situation.
-Alabama Credit Union

text: Your daily balance changes day to day. Which will cause you to think you have money in the bank. Soon as you swipe your card thinking it’s in the positive , they put a transaction back on your account from weeks ago. Causing you to pay overdraft fees. That’s how they get you...

text: I have been using this branch as my primary branch since returning to AL in 2019. The staff is always professional and kind. I appreciate their assistance.

name: Lisa Kennedy
text: Great people working here. They will go beyond their call of duty to help you when needed. I would give them more stars if available!  And Covid active. They keep cleaners coming in snd disinfecting and the workers are abiding all distance and masks andhand sanitizer.  They are awesome!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to review this location, Lisa. I’m glad to read you had such a wonderful experience, and I've made sure these kind words are forwarded to the appropriate teams. -Jessica, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: Matthew Nuss
text: I understand social distancing guidelines. I understand wearing proper face covering during the times of Covid. However, since the "outbreak" you "must have an appointment" to even enter the bank lobby. The number listed for making said appointment is never answered, when trying to call for 30+ minutes, no response whatsoever. I prefer doing what banking I need to do in person, inside the bank, and being told to "go through the drive thru" is getting beyond ridiculous. Service has declined terribly since the outbreak of Covid.

resp.text: I apologize for any inconvenience, Matthew. As an essential business, we strive to remain open where we can to serve you, while continuing to prioritize the safety of our customers and employees. Since we are practicing reduced lobby access with social distancing measures, you may need to make an appointment to meet with a banker at some locations. If you’d like to discuss your concerns further, please feel free to email us at HLSocial@wellsfargo.com (no account numbers). -Shannon, Wells Fargo HL Social

name: Emmitt Bishop (barbaroi52)
text: I bought a can of fix a flat from this place and found out the top was broken when I tried to use it. I handed it to the clerk and proceeded to pick up another can of a different brand. Because it seemed to be higher quality I walked to the counter to pay the difference. The clerk then informs me that he knows that I broke the top. That was news to me considering that it was broken when I opened it. He proceeds to tell me he doesn't trust me and gets offended that I'm taking issue with being accused and insulted over a $4.00 can of fix a damned flat. Because I had no time or patience for this nonsense I paid full price for the second can and walked away in complete disbelief of the audacity of this exceptional human being. Why on earth would inspire distrust over 4.00 insignificant dollars that I paid with my bloody Platinum Business American Express card? People worried about 4 damned dollars rarely even see one of those. Oh I forgot I'm black. Silly me.

name: C R
text: We are on MANDATORY FACE MASK USE and 50% of the people had no face mask even though there is a sign on the door. The employees have been told that refusing anyone service at this location will cost them their employment. I will be giving the health department and the Governors office a call. The Government MANDATED this and no one's employment should be threatened. The longer we continue to ignore this mandate the longer we are going to continue to battle this virus and continue deplete the economy due to the inability for employees to return to work.

resp.text:
Hi C R,
With safety as our highest priority, BP is closely monitoring the spread of the illness caused by COVID-19. Many of our retail sites are independently owned and operated, and we have recommended that station owners take actions to prevent spreading, including placing hand sanitizers at registers and disinfecting frequently touched objects and surfaces such as pin pads and nozzles. We have contacted the station owner to remind them of the need to follow local and state requirements.
Thanks,
BP

name: Dennis Baribeau
text: I go to this gas station everyday. They keep beer/fountain drinks/cigarettes well stocked, but beware if you're buying sandwiches/burritos from the cooler in the middle of the store. They're not dated like they're supposed to be & on 2 separate occasions I've bought a sandwich or burrito there & it was completely moldy. They need to enforce FIFO with their inventory & properly date products. I'm just lucky enough to have checked under the bun before eating it.  Otherwise it's a gas station with good service.

name: Angie Dunham
text: I originally posted my review a little over a year ago. I felt the need to update it due to recent travels. This location is one of my top 2 favorites! Everyone is always very friendly and welcoming! I stop here a couple of times a day 7 days a week (unless I'm out of town) for crushed ice and whatever else I need at the time. I'm always met with a smile and personal greeting. I will continue to be a loyal customer! They also have the best bathrooms and gas prices!

text: Staff is friendly enough and they keep my cigarettes in stock at a decent price. The place is tiny and the bathrooms are outside which sucks but the place could be worse.

If I could give a 0 I would but 1 was the only option to leave a review. Regions sucks.!

resp.text: Our apologies for any frustrations that were caused during your visit. We definitely hear your concerns and appreciate your feedback. We've made sure to pass it along to the appropriate channels. -Trish

name: Lisa Davison
text: Have banked with regions since I had a minors account with my parents. Now, have been a customer for 30 yrs. I love the people at regions, the bank itself. Would love to see more inside availability during covid. Not everyone can do by appointment in sudden situations, but other than this, I have no complaints with my banking service. I plan to be a life long customer of Regions and look forward to many years of banking with my local branches!

name: Tamica Lamar
text: Horrible!!’ My mom had a saving account and checking she put me and My brothers on the account as beneficiaries they did not explained to her that it wasn’t like if she’ll die the next person in line will be over it so they have to write a check separate between all of us which it’s not a problem but when I explained one of the brothers is in prison for 15 years they told me he has to be there to get his cut but we all have to be there to sign off on it I was so upset we need that money to pay for my mother bills I’m so upset that’s her money not there’s so we have to get a lawyer I will not recommend anyone to get an account there 3 years ago my uncle died he had a account there he died shortly when he got the account he had no one over is account he had 8000 in his checking he had no burial insurance my mother and my aunt talked to them about it they told them to bring a death certificate they will work something out well my aunt and mother did they copied it and told them there was nothing they can do so my mom and aunt had to take money out of there pockets to bury their brother my mom had his statements they took every bit of his money out of his account that’s horrible please go to another bank they have no compassion for their consumers

name: Phillip Durham
text: The drive thru only is open on saturday , and they wont even cash their own customers checks thru the drive thru window if the receiver/(person cashing checks) , uhh isnt that kinda how check cashing and writing works , THE PERSON THAT WRITES THE CHECK OWES SOMEONE , THEREFORE,  THE BANK THE CHECK IS WRITTEN ON OWES THAT SAME PERSON ,REGARDLESS OF THEM being their customer , what if i was looking for a great bank to put my vast fortune in but wanted my bank to pay my debts thru their local branch on saturdays , Also what if im looking for a bank as a potential  customer , and I am trying to cash a check written to me by someone that is already a customer of regions and I try to cash the check this customer has written to me , and I am in serious , desperate need of the cash on that day , which is saturday , before 12:00pm  , and your open , but deny- said potential customer of cashing -said check written  by the - said existing regions customer , because that potential  customer isnt a customer  already , its un professional , and horrible business practice!
